40966887.review:
[h1] The Legacy of Quake [/h1]

Quake is like a blessing from the Nordic gods; revealing to us the concept of what a first person shooter should strive to be. It's strange and mysterious, yet at the same time formulated in a way that our human minds can comprehend. 

Quake is a lovecraftian shooter which id Software had taken inspiration from a number of things such as the gritty heavy metal soundtracks of Nine Inch Nails and Metallica to the Dungeons and Dragons sessions that members of the team had at the time. 

The level design consists of several themes, ranging from gothic to medieval to dark creepy caves to futuristic bases. All of which are filled with enemies waiting to smash, stomp, and rip you apart. 

If anybody could make such a game on interstellar levels, John Carmack could. 


[h1] The Development of Quake [/h1]

Quake was initially advertised in Commander Keen, titled "The Fight for Justice" as a sequel in what would be a trilogy. This idea was completely scrapped. 

Quake was born in the generation of when 3D gaming was relatively new. Instead of sprites, you had models. Instead of still images that always faced in your direction, you had three dimensional polygons. But would this mean that Quake would be flawless because of it's graphics alone? Of course not. While Quake had it's flaws, it left a legacy in the world of PC gaming, and even console gaming. 

In early 1997, the game was developed and released to use OpenGL which would allow the graphics card to render the scenes instead of having the CPU do the job. This lead to vastly improved frame rates, higher resolutions, and texture filtering. It also had experimental features such as reflections, transparent water, and even shadows casted by objects based on the lighting. In spring of 1997, Quake had finally made its way to Windows 95. 

If there was one thing to describe Quake on a technical level, it was definitely ahead of it's time. 


[h1] The Lore of Quake [/h1]

In Quake, you are sent on a mission to travel across four mysterious dimensions; each holding a rune required to face the final boss - the hideous monstrosity that is Shub-Niggurath. From gothic cities to medieval castles, lava-filled caves and dimly-lit dungeons, the game is divided into four "episodes", each culminating in the collection of a rune. The levels and some enemies of quake hearken back to the design and themes of doom which included Satanic imagery and bloodthirsty demons. While the first episode had a boss that had to be defeated in order to collect the rune, the other three did not. This was due to time constraints, one of the many sacrafices that Quake had to make in order to meet the deadline. 


[h1] Conclusion [/h1]

Rocket Jumping.

Speed runs.

Team Fortress.

Capture the Flag. 

Quake became more than what it was intended to be. From those wanting a trip down memory lane to those wanting a history lesson on the paramounts of PC gaming, Quake wasn't just a video game; it was a hobby. A perfect pastime for John Carmack when developing it, and a perfect pastime for PC gamers who played it.

40774039.review:
Quake,um jogo que revolucionou usando tecnologia 3D,da forma mais otimizada e limpa possível,e que marcou a época.
Mas já que todo mundo sabe disso vou direto a análise:
Quake é um ótimo FPS,onde possuímos um arsenal "diferente" de armas.Para os que estão acostumados com um arsenal comum de rifles,pistolas e snipers,não espere ver nada disso aqui,(a não ser a clássica shotgun)aqui possuímos metralhadoras de pregos e lançadores de explosivos entre outras armas destruidoras.
A história do jogo é bem básica,sendo muito similar ao do clássico Doom,mas quem se importa?queremos matar demônios!
Aliás,falando em demônios,infelizmente,o jogo não possui uma grande variação de inimigos,provavelmente devido a pressa de lançar o jogo.então se contente com vários Ogres na mesma fase.
Quantos as fases,o jogo tem um estilo bem diferentão de escolhas de nível,sendo necessário escolher o episódio e dificuldade através de portais.As fases pegam um pouco do estilo labiríntico do Doom,com um esquema de chaves,porém,um pouco menos chato e muito mais frenético,com fases entupidas de demônios,com temas bem variados de castelos até fábricas sempre num estilo dark.
A música do jogo infelizmente não está disponível nessa versão Steam,mas com pequenas modificações,você já consegue ouvir elas.Quanto a música... bem... é mais ou menos,só esperava mais da música já que teve a ajuda de alguns membros da banda "Nine Inch Nails",que por sinal,tinha ótimas músicas.
Com o jogo nas plataformas atuais(como Windows 7 e 10),você pode ter uma certa dificuldade em rodar o jogo(como eu tive),então, o recomendado é o uso de "launchers" mais modernos,eu recomendo o Darkplaces e o DirectQ.
Concluindo,pra mim,o jogo desde seu desenvolvimento trazia uma idéia interessante,querendo trazer elementos de RPG,mas com a pressa pro lançamento,acabou virando um "Doom 3d".
Apesar dessa pressa,o jogo ainda pode ser legal para muitos,minha nota é 7.5/10

40428224.review:
Note: My playtime in Steam does not reflect how long I've played this game. I spent most of my time playing it with a sourceport.

After playing through Doom a few years ago, I bought Quake. Time went by, and I finally got around to finishing this game. Quake is like a spiritual successor to the Doom series. You fight demons in different dimensions, and it's awesome. It's pretty spooky too.

[h1]Pros[/h1]
[list]
[*]Has all the awesome FPS action that Doom brings to the table but IN 3D!
[*]There are tons of cool weapons and enemies.
[*]There are four episodes that you can play in any order.
[*]You can choose between difficulty levels.
[*]You can save and load your game anywhere.
[/list]

[h1]Cons[/h1]
[list]
[*]This game is dark. I mean it's LITERALLY dark. I couldn't see much because the Steam port has mediocre resolution settings. After you buy the game, download a free sourceport online to see things better. I used darkplaces.
[*]There's no music in this version. You have to play it yourself or download it and set it up in the game somehow.
[/list]

40293930.review:
Admittedly, I have only just recently played through and beaten this game for the first time. As someone who has played and beaten DOOM and DOOM II countless times, I realized that I was missing out by not buying Quake, and as soon as all the games went on sale, you can be sure I picked 'em all up.

And I'm glad I did.

If you are a fan of (ye olde) DOOM, or just id Software's games in general, but HAVEN'T played Quake, then there is no excuse you can make. You NEED to pick this game up. I loved the campaign and have been loving replaying it and messing around with source ports like DarkPlaces (highly-recommended, by the way).

If you aren't familiar with the formula laid out by DOOM and it's sequels/expansions from the mid 90's, it's quite simple: run and gun through sprawling, maze-like levels, filled with incredibly-imaginative enemies and using spectacular guns. It's fast-paced for sure, and a ton of fun. Quake of course adds a new layer of complexity with the full-3D environments, but the premise is much the same, albeit with more gothic/Lovecraft-inspired settings as opposed to being set directly in Hell.

A few things to note:
- I recommend looking at some of the guides on Steam and elsewhere for configurations and such to get the game running well on your computer (by that I mean resolutions, mouse look, and some other modern settings).
- If you're really used to the "DOOM Meta", it may be difficult to get used to the different guns and enemy types at first (I know it was for me).
- The game is very, very brown, but the atmosphere created by that color pallette, the textures, the level designs, the sounds, and the soundtrack (tutorials for downloading/installing which can be found online), is unfrigginbelievable.
- If you're familiar with the Ultimate DOOM in particular, you may know that Episode IV: Thy Flesh Consumed is vastly more difficult than episodes I-III. While the difficulty spike isn't quite as high in Episode IV of Quake, it is still decently high, so be warned, and save often.

Overall, I cannot recommend it enough. A true classic that has stood the test of time and lives on as one of the greats.

40253095.review:
Quake lo compré debido a que era un juego que disfruté en mi niñez y ahora despues de tanto tiempo sigo pasandomelo en grande con él.
Un gran juego que esta bastante equilibrado entre dificultad y jugabilidad, y que a pesar de sus años sigue siendo entretenido y rápido.
Son niveles cortos y laberinticos de entre 3-12 minutos (dependiendo de lo rapido o cuidadoso que seas, o si te empeñas en descubrir todos los secretos de todos los niveles).
Al juego le falta la banda sonora, altas resoluciones y algun detalle más que quedan solucionados con buscar y descargar el "Ultimate Quake Patch" como indican otros analisis.
En definitiva,
¿es un buen juego? Sí
¿es entretenido? Sí
¿es dificil? Alguna muerte te llevarás, pero nada excesivo.
¿lo vas a disfrutar? Depende, si juegas por los graficos y esperas una jugabilidad similar a los juegos de hoy en día, pues seguramente no puesto que el juego ya tiene sus añitos, pero por el contrario si sabes apreciar sus elementos, su dificultad y sus escenarios teniendo en cuenta su antiguedad lo vas a disfrutar y rejugar sin duda.

39945217.review: One of the most balanced and fun singleplayer FPS experiences you can play. I've completed the campaign about 15 times and I can honestly say that this is my favorite game of all time. The monsters are simple, and yet combined with placement and level design can change up gameplay and add some complexity. The weapon roster is satisfiying, and each gun has a purpose, even the starting shotgun. In addition, with 32 levels split into 4 episodes, the game has more than enough content to keep you interested, and being an old game costs little to nothing. Mostly, I play in source ports such as Darkplaces or Quakespasm. I highly recommend that you download these, as they can make it easier to play the game with modern settings and resolutions. Quake is a masterpiece of game design that any self-respecting FPS fan should play at some point. It's that good.

39843296.review:
Lawa, flaki, krwiożercze demony z piekła rodem, czyli mowa tu o... QUAKE, jednej z pierwszych gier FPP osadzonych w realnym świecie 3D.

Był rok 1997, kiedy w moje łapki "wpadła" produkcja od ID Software z napisem... QUAKE (firmy tej chyba nie muszę nikomu przedstawiać, bo zapewne każdy ją kojarzy). Długo się nie zastanawiąjąc, odpaliłem swój "kombajn" czyt. Pentium 200 MMX z 32 mb ram, i nie mogąc się już doczekać, zainstalowałem oraz odpaliłem omawianą dzisiaj produkcję. Mym oczom objawiło się prawdziwe dziecko diabła... .
Quake to gra która została wydana w 1996 r. i jest totalną klasyką. W grze wcielamy się w bezimiennego żółnierza który ma ocalić świat przed hordą krwiożerczych bestii przybywających z innych wymiarów - tak pokrótce prezentuje się fabuła tej produkcji. Do wyboru mamy trzy klasyczne stopnie trudności, (easy, normal, hard) i gdy któryś z nich wybierzemy, możemy już skierować swoją postać do jednego z czterech wymiarów. Nasz bohater musi uzbierać 4 magiczne runy które będą niezbędne do unicestwienia matki całego zła o nazwie "Shub-Niggurath". Pod koniec każdego z wymiarów uzyskuje się daną runę. Podczas naszej rozgrywki będziemy przemierzać cały szereg mrocznych lokacji takich jak np. krypty czy też pałac demonów w których będą na nas czychać różne bestie. Twórcy zatroszczyli się o różnorodność przeciwników, i tak np. można spotkać zombie (jak na które przystało, nie będziemy w stanie ich zabić zwykłą bronią, bo po upadku wstaną...będzie trzeba je rozczłonkować za pomocą np. granatnika :) ), zwykłych żółnierzy, dziwną postać na wzór yeti, ciskającą w nas potężną wiązką prądu, kreaturę na wzór pająka, mrocznych rycerzy oraz wiele, wiele innych ciekawych szkodników :) .Oczywiście nasza postać nie będzie bezbronna, i zostaniemy wyposażeni w cały szereg broni, począwszy od shotguna, szybkostrzelnego działka a kończywszy na granatniku, wyrzutni rakiet oraz innych ciekawych "smakołykach". Twórcy zatroszczyli się również o "psycholi", dla których idealną bronią będzie... siekiera :) . Warto tutaj nadmienić, że przy obsłudze poszczególnych rodzajów broni trzeba uważać, by nie popełnić samobójstwa. W szczególności trzeba uważać na granatnik bądź wyrzutnię rakiet. Bardzo mile zaskoczyło mnie również to, iż twórcy wszystko przemyśleli, i przy korzystaniu pod wodą z broni rażącej prądem, oczywiście wypłyniemy "bebechami" do góry jak zdechłe rybki w akwarium ;) .Podczas naszej wyprawy będziemy korzystać z różnych tzw. Power - up, czyli znajdek które będą nam oferowały czasowe bonusy, takie jak np. niewidzialność, podwójne obrażenia czy też wzmocniony pancerz do poziomu 666, dzięki któremu nic nam nie stanie na przeszkodzie. Jak na klasyka przystało, nasze zdrowie będziemy regenerować za pomocą apteczek rozłożonych w różnych miejscach. Gra jak na tamte czasy oferowała dobrą oprawę graficzną, a jeśli chodzi o dźwięk, to jak dla mnie jest rewelacyjny, słychać "soczyste" brzmienie wystrzeliwanych przez nas pocisków itd... . Quake jest grą w której nie zabraknie krwi, jak już wcześniej wspomniałem, istnieje możliwość "rozerwania naszych przeciwników". Jest to bez wątpienia gra - legenda, którą jak najbardziej mogę polecić. Można tutaj jeszcze dodać, że idealnie nadawała się dla graczy lubiących pograć sobie z innymi przez sieć. Quake to pozycja obowiązkowa dla każdego "wyjadacza" gatunku. POLECAM!!!

Dziękuję za uwagę
STUG

39836416.review:
Quake has only gotten BETTER with age. The simpler geometry now in crisp high resolution 22 years later gives way to an otherworldly look, and it's art style and design sensibilities put it apart as a wholly unique experience still after all these years. Mixing sci-fi, fantasy, and lovecraft together in a way that somehow works, no other shooter quite matches it's feel. How many other shooters have a (awesomely monolithic in aesthetic design) Nailgun instead of a machinegun?

Carmack's excellent engine design and Id's excellent sense to make the game open source like it's predecessor has lead to one of the most impressive and mind blowing user created content scenes around (also like it's predecessor). Few games with mods have anything like Arcane Dimensions, and few games this old are still going this strong. 

As others have said, finding the original Trent Reznor soundtrack online which has been omitted from this release is absolutely essential. As is some kind of sourceport. Quakespasm is great (but not super duper vanilla/faithful, can be made close to it tho with autoexec.cfg tweaks) and is pretty much a must for some of the very best user made stuff. Whichever sourceport you go with, I personally recommend disabling the texture filtering. The pixels look great IMO (love pixel art) and give the game a real grit.

However you do it, you should play Quake if you haven't and like this sort of thing (fast paced skill based fps).

39735974.review:
Released in 1996, this was a revolutionary game in its time, introducing a fully-3D game engine (fully 3D-rendered enemies, level geometry allowing rooms to exist on top of one another and also complex geometry), a wildly popular multiplayer mode, a CD audio soundtrack, and, most of all, the ability to create mods that could alter the entire gameplay, introducing new weapons and new monsters in addition to new levels, something that couldn't be properly done in Doom WADs of the time.

Quake, on it's own, is an awesome, awesome game. The dark, gritty artstyle of the game is perfect, the monsters have awesome Lovecraftian designs and are very fun to fight, the soundtrack sets in the haunting atmosphere, and the fast-paced gameplay is an absolute blast. The singleplayer campaign, all 30 levels of it, is nothing short of absolute fun to blast through. It is also perfectly complemented by the countless user-made maps of quality, most notably the Map Jams and Arcane Dimensions.

Overall, this is an absolutely awesome game that stands the test of time 22 years on. 10/10.

Classic game that got past me back in the days of thge mid-ninties since I had a shitty computer and played mainly Duke Nukem and GoldenEye for my FPS fix. Came back after all these years to give it a fair shake and I must admit, it's damn good. You can tell it was lovingly crafted with the great level design, different aesthetics for each realm, and variation in enemy types. It was a blast to go back and finish this game off and check it off my list. Easily best in show for gaming in 1996.

Side note: If you buy this on Steam, you'll have to download and manually install the soundtrack from somewhere else. The original game had the OST on a CD, and the Steam version doesn't include it. Please do it as the NIN produced soundtrack is well worth it for the ambiance.

39707425.review:
Quake - идейный наследник Wolfenstein 3d и DOOM, разработанный студией id Software, под личным руководством Джона Кармока - по моему мнению, являющегося отцом такого жанра, как FPS.
Как я и говорил, в QUAKE доведены до идеала идеи и механика, заложенные в прошлых шутерах id Software, но эта игра выделялась в то время на фоне всех существующих игр и стала в последствии одним из самых узнаваемых, уважаемых и культовых игр как в жанре FPS, так и в игровой индустрии в целом.
-Именно в Quake появилась такая геймплейная фишка как Rocket Jump
-Именно в Quake появилась эта дикая динамика, пресущая как многим в последствии киберспортивным шутерам, так и серии в частности.
-Именно Quake сделал прорыв в графике за счет движка Quake Engine, который очень часто будут использовать при создании шутеров от первого лица
-И именно благодаря Quake появилось такое понятие как ''Киберспорт''

39497482.review:
Does it even need to be said anymore? This game is the shit !

I have minimal playtime on steam, that's because I use an external engine to run it (look below for more explanation).

It can be a chore to get it running properly though:
-you will need to download the soundtrack somewhere, also for the mission packs if you're going to play them. Then put them in the right folder (ld1 for normal quake, hipnotic for scourge of armagon, rogue for dissolution of eternity).
-I recommend using an external engine for running the game, there are a bunch of them, I'm using quakespasm, it's free to download and remains faithfull to the original but also makes the graphics look somewhat nicer. Follow the instructions if given. Not any engine I tried is without flaws, quakespasm was for me the best option, some flickering textures might occur when opening doors but that's it. Darkplaces engine for example has some minor AI issues at times.
-there are a bunch of console commands you will have to try out in order to get the right visuals (rather personal) and keybindings. I will list some of them below. Also check the ingame settings.


desktop shortcut commands:
-If you want anti aliasing: right click on the quakespasm shortcut on your desktop (you need to make the shortcut yourself, if you're using quakespasm), go to properties and add -fsaa 8 in the target line, like this: C:\SteamLibrary\steamapps\common\Quake\quakespasm.exe -fsaa 8 (if it's installed on C drive that is)
- to run scourge of armagon with quakespasm: duplicate quakespasm shortcut and change target like this: C:\SteamLibrary\steamapps\common\Quake\quakespasm.exe -fitz -game hipnotic -fsaa 8
-to run dissolution of eternity with quakespasm: duplicate quakespasm shortcut and change target like this: C:\SteamLibrary\steamapps\common\Quake\quakespasm.exe -fitz -game rogue -fsaa 8

console commands (in game or config.cfg):
-gl_texturemode GL_NEAREST_MIPMAP_NEAREST
-gl_texturemode 3
-bind mwheeldown weapprev
-bind mwheelup weapnext
-bind f5 "echo Quicksaving...; wait; save quick" 
-bind f9 "echo Quickloading...; wait; load quick"
-gl_texture_anisotropy 16
-r_particles 2
-host_maxfps x (x=value you want as frames per second)
-cl_maxfps x (x=value you want as frames per second) fps command depends on which external engine you use.
-fov x (x=value you want for field of view)

You will have to try out the different console commands for yourself, see which works for you. They may be different depending on which engine you use. Repeat them for every mission pack. the above commands are the one I use, look online for more explanation. I know it can be a chore, but it's totally worth it. Too bad you have to figure this out all by yourself without any help from steam, but that's just the way it is with old games like this.

I hope this was somewhat of a help. I might update this in the future to make it more comprehensive, in the meanwhile use your google skills to find guides online.

39360330.review:
[code]На момент написания этого обзора игра полностью пройдена (Да-да, Шуб-Нуггурат тоже сдох), далее планирую пройти официальное дополнение от MachineGames (Dimension of the Past или в простонародии DOPA) и масштабную модификацию (если не тотальную конверсию) Arcane Dimensions.[/code]

[h1]Рейнджер пытается удержать гвоздомёт в своих непослушных трясущихся руках: встреча с шэмблером отняла почти все силы. Раз гвоздь, два гвоздь, три... Боеприпасы на исходе. И как ему повезло попасть в это забытое самим Господом Богом место? Воздух накалён до предела, казалось, что непрерывное жужжание огровых бензопил раздаётся прямо у самого уха. Ну что ж, надо выбраться отсюда живым и не дать этим грёбаным уродам одержать победу на Земле.[/h1]

Синопсис игры прост: Рейнджеру вручают старую броню, топорик и простенький помповый дробовик. Ну и говорят ему: "У нас тут Червоточина открылась, а из неё всякие твари полезли. Демоны охренели в край, что решили с военной мощью Земли потягаться. Иди разберись, а." Стоит упомянуть, что твари, полезшие из Червоточины, таки почти поставили всё человечество на колени, так что не будет у Рейнджера подмоги на его пути.

Но игра далеко не про сюжет. Quake - одна из тех игр, что играют с самим игроком, постоянно подсовывая оному свои правила и законы, играя с воображением человека, который решился отправиться в путешествие по её уровням. Геймплейно Quake - шутер так называемой "старой школы", таких сейчас не делают (или делают, но очень редко). Беги стреляй, перезарядки нет, укрытий нет, здоровье не регенерирует, процесс прохождения зависит только от умения игрока. Особенно это чувствуется на высоком уровне сложности - игра не оставляет игроку выбора, как будто говоря ему "Теперь ты сам по себе". И действительно, за ручку здесь водить не будут (как во многих современных играх водят за руку, ненавижу современные тенденции).

Про дизайн разговор отдельный. Над уровнями трудились именитые дизайнеры (Джон Ромеро, Тим Уиллитс и Американ МакГи). И тут виден диссонанс на каждом эпизоде: если первые уровни выглядят как научно-фантастические конструкции (Уиллитс и МакГи), то гений Ромеро (до того, как скатился со своей Дайкатаной) задумал воплотить дарк-фэнтези во всей его красе. Проклятые, тёмные, сырые, замки. На стенах иконы и распятые трупы, покрытые содранной человеческой кожей элементы интерьера, пентаграммы и мозаичные, как в церквях и храмах, окна. Переплёты этажей и коридоров. Тебе удалось, Джонни, чёрт возьми.

Саундтрек? Господи, этот саундтрек великолепен. Не такой динамичный, как в DooM, но Quake не нужен динамичный саундтрек, Quake нужен саундтрек, подчёркивающий мрачность и безысходность происходящего (на самом деле, в саундтреке есть пара динамик-тем). Это эмбиент. Тёмный, тягучий, мрачный. Завывания ветров, детский плач, вопли: порой всё это можно услышать, если долго прислушиваться. А приложил к нему руку Трент Резнор, бессменный фронтмен Иiиe Iиch Иails (логотип NIN можно увидеть на коробках с гвоздями, а название группы переводится как "девятидюймовые гвозди").

Игра вышла отличной. Она проложила дорогу к развитию железа и графических технологий, хотя и не была первой полностью полигональной. На коде её движка базируются другие движки и игры. Игра, положившая начало киберспортивному развитию. Да и вообще, если бы не Quake, никто бы никогда не узнал, что такое CS и Team Fortress.

[h1]Я кончил.[/h1]

39252032.review:
I don't think that Quake itself needs a review (watch the hourlong video by Retroahoy if in doubt), but Steam release surely does. Whatever reason you have to buy it, please keep in mind that you will have some time spent on decade old forum threads just to make it playable. It is NOT an "out-of-the-box" experience, when I tried to play it for the first time I just got tired of setting it up and ditched it for an year or so. 

1) There's no music. And this is bad. OST by Trent effing Reznor is great by itself alone, but together with occult imagery of the game it is a complete experience. Try to imagine playing latest Doom game with no music. This is worse. Can be fixed by quakespasm, there's a guide in the community.

2) If you are rubbing your snout against a fullHD or higher resolution monitor, consider aquiring some coding skills (not the in-game console) to launch it in any non-default resolution. Quakespasm make this easier too

3) Remember when we taught our games to understand mouselook? Me neither. Yet this is what you will need to do, and this will be the easiest task of all, console command +mlook if my memory serves me well.

4) Ready to enjoy the finest pixelart textures? Wrong, OpenGL filters (let's say blurs) them by default, making them painful to look at. Can be fixed by console as well, look it up.

BUT. If you are devoted to having this game in your library to show off hours of gameplay, do it. After all this time and effort it is so worth it I have no regrets at all.

38988820.review:
Okay...so the Steam version of this game comes with a crappy source port called GLQuake. Don't use it. You can't change the resolution and there's no soundtrack because id thought it would be a good idea to have the soundtrack run from the CD. Download any number of other, better source ports (Steam discussion boards and Google are your friends here) so you'll be able to play at a resolution that works friendly with your monitor and doesn't give you a headache, and if you're extremely lucky, you'll be able to get the soundtrack to work properly.

Quake is a WONDERFUL game. Always has been, always will be. There's just a lot you have to do to it now to get it to run the way it should. Whether you want to do the extra work is entirely up to you.

38973500.review:
Одна из лучших игр тех времён, прорыв в технологическом плане и мой первый шутер)
Про квейк сложно говорить - это просто шутер со много какими монстрами и с достаточно минимальным арсеналом, где нет ничего лишнего - рукопашка, пара дробовиков, пара автоматических стволов, пара взрывчатых фиговин разного типа стрельбы и одно убер оружие. Зверинец же достаточно пёстрый, словно в каком нибудь пэйнкиллере. Тут тебе и космонавты с плазмопушками, и рыцари с мечами и магией, и огромные белые чудища, при виде которых одни визжат, а другие достают топоры, в очередной раз доказывая своё мастерство (Ибо пиком умения играть в Quake считается умение убить Шамблера чисто в рукопашную (У меня, кстати говоря, получалось)). Сеттинг уровней такой же - тут вам и футуристические базы, и средневековые замки, и какое то непонятное древнее измерение.
А геймплей - если вы умеет играть в подобные игры, примерно на моём уровне, то ваше прохождение будет похоже на забег поехавшего маньяка, терзающего бедных Шамблеров и прочих зверушек, который при этом летает на ракетомёте как на метле в хогвартс, огибая различные головоломки и прекращая полёт только при сборе всевозможных Quad Damage (Третий и четвёртый эпизод прям их клонкдайк, иногда бывало, что почти весь уровень пробегал с учетверённым уроном).
Жалко, что ID Software начали потом прыгать от сэттинга к сэттингу, делая то войну со строггами (Q2, Q4, ET:QW), то чисто сетевые шутеры (Q3, QC). Но иной истинный фанат всё ждёт возвращения к истокам - к лавкравстким тварям.
10 из 10, для меня это наилучший шутер.

38699850.review: Quake foi um dos primeiros jogos que tive para o Nintendo 64. Na época tinha por volta de uns 6/7 anos e tinha medo de jogar este jogo. Levei um bom tempo para zerar pois não sabia como se passava da ultima fase. kkkk após algumas décadas ainda continuo tendo um certo "frio na barriga". Para a época foi um jogo revolucionario. gráficos ótimos, iluminação, inimigos, armas, tudo em perfeita ordem. apesar de não ter uma história, o jogo te envolve em um pouco mais de 30 cenarios com puro tiroteio e demonios para todos os lados. 38634616.review:
Quake. This is the greatest FPS game of all time. Even all of these years later, this holds up like nothing else quite does.

Of course, now that it's been over twenty years since the game was released, some new technology is around, and using modern Quake clients is the best way to play it now. For a singleplayer experience as close to the original as possible, get QuakeSpasm. For a more modern look to singleplayer, check out DarkPlaces. For QuakeWorld multiplayer, get ezQuake.

Quake has a style to it that no other game has really tried to capture, although that is being changed as of the time this is being written with the development of DUSK. Not even any of the other games in the Quake series are like Quake. Every aspect of the game is incredibly gothic, which is a good thing, seeing as this game was inspired heavily by gothic literature. Quake is a realm in which the overall atmosphere feels undeniably... wrong. Every environment is dark and covered in filth. Every creature in the game would love nothing more than to tear you to shreds. Every area teems with life, yet the ever-looming presence of death is inescapable. Every structure feels alien in nature, yet somehow so human. The walls are filled with their own secrets. Any doorway could be an ambush. All objects metal are rusted. All structures built are falling apart. And all creatures moving are mortal. Even you.

This game (when properly configured) feels amazing to play. The levels are chunky, the controls are tight and smooth, and when you're bunnyhopping all over the place, it's incredibly fast. Seriously, if you only play QuakeWorld multiplayer for about a month straight and try to play any other multiplayer FPS game, they will feel clunky and slow. Even Quake 3/Live and Quake Champions feel slow after lots of QW.

The singleplayer levels are fun and have lots of replay value. Bumping up difficulty levels, speedrunning, and secret hunting means that you can run through them many times without getting bored. Heck, when I test to make sure that I have Quake working on a new system, I test by playing throught E1M1, and then I generally wind up playing through the first couple of levels of E1 because I enjoy it every time.

Multiplayer is fantastic. deathmatches, duels, and team games are all insanely frenetic, and take mountains of skill to get good at. Adrenaline will flow through you the whole way through. When you want to wind down and relax with all two of your friends (may or may not be counting yourself in that number) who play Quake still, coop is a fun way to play without constantly being 95% of the way to having a heart attack.

This game also has an enourmous number of maps, mods, and other goodies to keep both singleplayer and multiplayer fresh. No need to worry about running out of things to do in Quake.

Now for some of the cons of multiplayer. Weapon balance doesn't exist in this game. The rocket launcher and lightning gun beat out all other weapons always. Also, most of the people still playing QW have been playing it for years, if not decades, so they'll be seven gazillion times better than any new player could ever hope to be upon entry. If you stick to it and ask around for help (most of the guys in the QW community are nice and will give new guys a hand), you will get better. You just have to give it some time.

...Oh, singleplayer flaws? Quake doesn't have any of those.

Seriously, If you haven't already bought at least a couple of copies of Quake already, get one! Right now! Do it! It's worth more than Steam is ever going to charge you for it!

38428576.review:
You do not talk about the history of FPS games without mentioning Quake. The first real 3D game where the dead bodies of fallen enemies did not consist of sprites and you could actually circle around them and you could see these corpses from all angles. It was a big deal back then at a time where hardware accelerators were at our doorstep (instead of AMD Radeon and Nvidia GeForce people kept 3dfx Voodoo in their mind).

Quake 2 had a lot of sci-fi in it but the 1st in the series still had demons and pentagrams, so, essentially, the creators stuck to the concept of Doom. They applied a lot of dark fantasy, though, with chainsaw-wielding ogres and knights and zombies. The title is a reference to the entity that is tampering with the teleportation technology our government is experimenting with. You know the drill from Doom already: 4 chapters, lots of levels (including a secret at the end) and a boss fight at the end of each.

It is nice to see this classic in a digital form and that it runs well. Soundtrack was a major part of these games and neither the 1st nor the 2nd episode have them included. I'm not sure if there's a manual workaround for this but with some mods such as ezQuake you can make sure the game can be played on higher resolutions so that you can enjoy the convenience of modern PCs. A must have for fans - would love to see an "HD remaster" one day.

38315844.review:
Si tengo que buscar una palabra para definir a este juego, esa palabra sería divertido. Es un juego que te asegura unas cuantas horas de diversión pura. Si lo que buscas es terror, lo encontraras en contadas ocasiones. Si lo que buscas es una buena historia, anda buscando otro juego. Ahora, si lo que buscas es pasar un buen rato, dale una oportunidad a este juego.

A lo largo de sus 4 episodios, vamos a sortear dificultades cada vez mayores, siendo el último episodio realmente difícil, y con escenarios muy enredados (al punto de que mas de una vez no sabes para donde ir). A esto hay que sumar los secret places que hay en todos los niveles (algunos muy difíciles de encontrar), y un nivel escondido que hay por episodio (mucho más difíciles de encontrar aún). Muy bueno para los que les gusta recorrer cada centimetro del mapa, o a los que les gusta sacarle al juego todo el jugo posible. Si lo tuyo es ir a los tiros de principio a fin sin explorar, lo vas a disfrutar igual, pero no solo que te vas a perder de lo mejor del juego (sus lugares ocultos de manera tan magistral), sino que el juego se te va a hacer un poco más corto.

En cuanto al apartado gráfico, es obvio que está lejísimos de cualquier juego de hoy en día, pero hay que destacar que a pesar de esto, Quake tiene un estilo bien propio. Si bien los gráficos resultan feos en un primer momento, una vez que te acostumbras te llegan hasta a gustar, porque, hay que reconocerlo, a veces muchos gráficos no aseguran un estilo agradable.

De la banda sonora no puedo hablar, porque la versión de Steam no viene con ella, supongo que la experiencia de juego debe ser totalmente distina. Pero, lamentablemente, por lo que víel juego originalmente no la traía incluída, sino que corría desde un cd un tema por episodio, y es bastante difícil lograr hacer funcionar eso en computadoras modernas.

De la historia no hay nada que decir, porque prácticamente no hay historia. Se trata solo de ir pasando niveles, y al final de cada episodio, una explicación muy breve de la historia. O sea que la historia del juego terminan siendo un par de páginas de texto y nada más que eso. Como dato extra, se pueden encontrar múltiples referencias al universo creado por Lovecraft, así que si te gusta su literatura, no podés no jugar este juego.

Para una mejor experiencia recomiendo poner el código +mlook en la pantalla que se abre con la tecla que está debajo del esc. Con ese código podemos mover la camara no solo en modo horizontal, sino también en vertical, siendo una experiencia de juego mucho más agradable.

Definitivamente recomiendo este juego. Mi puntaje sería un 8/10 al juego, ya que mi única crítica sería la historia, y un 7/10 a la versión de Steam por no incluir la música (entiendo que no venía como parte del juego, pero creo que no era tan difícil añadirla al mismo para ofrecer un producto completo)

38133543.review:
[h1]A Middle Child[/h1]
Ahh Quake. The underrated child of the iD FPS family. The eldest brother - Wolfenstein 3D - got himself some glory living off welfare for the first few parts of it’s life but bounced back being a partner with the 2nd oldest one, which is Doom. Who shared the story of Wolfenstein with more mistakes but a bigger boom at the start. Of course, Rage - the little brother - is the most popular new franchise for iD. But am I missing someone? Yes. Quake was the one that came between Rage and Doom. For this entry had some really interesting things about it. Let me tell you, it’s a great game.

[h1]Dark Halls[/h1]
	Quake’s aesthetic is actually all dark and gloomy. Not satanically evil but kick-ass in a sense - like Doom. This stuff - if it was a modern game - could be as terrifying as Call of Duty: World War 2’s ‘Zombies’ mode. The theme is Lovecraftian. Monsters from the most disrupted and broken of minds; beasts that wouldn’t just scare or harm you, but cause you to kill yourself as soon as possible to alive your being from any possible notation of that thing existing. It’s also never too dark; preventing a case of the “3Dg3Z” - a design condition that causes a game to be overly intense in lower light usage in order to try to scare the player. This usually fails and makes it look stupid. Henceforth: the 3Dg3Z.

[h1]Smooth Controls Make Smooth Praise[/h1]
	The gameplay of Quake makes sense - a Doom-like game with some tweaks - but it’s actually pretty important. First of all; the new Quake engine - iD Tech 2 - is fully 3D! Doom was 2.5D. It was on the cusp of being fully 3D, but it retained sprites and couldn’t have rooms-over-rooms. These problems and limitations to the Doom engine made iD create iD Tech 2. Actual 3D models were used and rooms-over-rooms were used. Finally, fully 3D rooms could be used. This changes everything. On the flow of movement, moving in this game is fluid and dare I say it, fun!! You can jump left and right without limits. The controls are smooth.
	On the end of how level progression works, it’s the standard for shareware games at the time - I’ll get into that later, 4 episodes with 7 levels each. But unlike Doom, the episode kinda cuts off. It’s kinda sad that iD didn’t have a boss at the end of each level. But the creativity of the final boss makes up for it.

[h1]Simple Game Makes a Simple Story[/h1]
	The story of Quake is simple. A lovecraftian beast named Shub-Niggurath, y’know, the ‘Goat of the Black Woods With a Thousand Young?’ And her thousand young are taking over the land of Quake. You - which is named “Ranger” and is voiced by Trent Reznor - have to stop this invasion by collecting the four runes of Quake’s magic. Earth, Hell/Fire, Elder, and Dark. Once you collect all four you will finally be rewarded with fighting Shub-Niggurath which looks more like an uprooted tree. So that’s that, you kill Shub-Niggurath. The game is now over. It’s kinda disappointing. No real story post-game. Just “You win asshole.”

Shareware Bliss
	The thing is that Quake happens to be a game with a shareware episode. What’s shareware? Well, it’s a distribution method where a version of your game that doesn’t contain ⅔ or ¾ of your game that can be legally pirated. I can go ahead and give everyone a shareware copy of Quake and I wouldn’t be legally fined! Hell, I’ll do it right now. In the description there’s a link to get Quake’s shareware episode.

[h1]Multiplayer Magic[/h1]
	Quake is the basis of all multiplayer shooters. It refined deathmatch causing a classic arena shooter. And while the game may be difficult to set up, once you get it going it’s a blast. Seriously. Try it out!

[h1]Verdict[/h1]
	Quake is a great game, no excuse. With multiplayer, singleplayer and even mods to boot you’ve got a great game. An instant 9/10 due to it being great on almost all aspects.

[b]Крайне рекомендую поставить поверх игры QuakeSpasm  [url=https://twitter.com/romero/status/745648132965400576](Ромеро одобряет)[/url] и саундтрек от NIИ тоже придётся отдельно скачать из-за какой-то xepни с авторскими правами.[/b]

Странное дело, в детстве Quake II казался мне намного круче первой кваки. Сейчас же погонять в первую часть оказалось приятнее.
В чём-то из-за окололавкрафтовской эстетики, в чём-то из-за более разнообразного бестиария и окружения не в пример однообразным киборгам в однообразных же коридорах Quake II.
Качество левелдизайна практически не проседает, за исключением пары гумозных уровней от Сэнди Питерсена в четвёртом эпизоде. Ромеро красавчик жи есть. На удивление хороши уровни от Американа МакГи в отличие от его eбaнутейших изысков в первом DOOM'е.
Отдельно хочется сказать про полуофициальный пятый эпизод - Dimension of the Past.
Он вышел в 2016 году от студии MachineGames (те ребята, что делают новые Wosfenstein'ы) как своебразный подарок к 20-летию игры, распространяется бесплатно в интернетах.
И он очень хорош!
Первые два уровня, правда, показались слишком лёгкими, даже успел подумать, что ОКАЗУАЛИЛИ (все эпизоды проходил на сложности Hard), но в дальнейшем эпизод даёт очень достойный челлендж с парой-тройкой неожиданных и крутых дизайнерских находок. Кроме того, он совсем не выглядит оторванным от старых эпизодов как некоторые другие попытки их продолжить.
Советую заценить всем, кто неравнодушен к оригинальной игре.

38020213.review:
Quake foi desenvolvido pela id Software e publicado pela GT Interactive em 22 de Junho de 1996 para MS-DOS e foi dos primeiros jogos a trazer gráficos renderizados em 3D em tempo real e também um dos primeiros à oferecer suporte a placas de aceleração gráficas 3D através do recém criado OpenGL. Seguido os passos de "Doom", Quake foi construído em cima da tecnologia e jogabilidade de seu antecessor.

O jogo é dividido em 4 episódios, porém não da mesma maneira que os outros títulos anteriores da id Software: aqui temos um HUB inicial para a escolha de dificuldade (EASY, NORMAL e HARD) e um quarto nível chamado NIGHTMARE que está escondido neste HUB; depois de escolhido o nível de dificuldade, 4 portais estarão disponíveis para jogar os 4 episódios na ordem de sua escolha. Só após finalizar os 4 episódios que a batalha final contra o Shub-Niggurath é liberada no HUB principal.

A campanha Single Player traz 30 fases, ou "mapas", espalhados nos 4 episódios, sendo que são 26 mapas normais e 4 secretos. Cada um desses portais consistem em um tema infernal e satânico remanescente de Doom, inspirados pelas obras de H.P. Lovercraft. Até mesmo algumas fases tem os nomes inspirados em suas obras como "Vaults of Zin" e "The Nameless City". O jogo iria trazer mais chefes Lovercraftianos porém esse conceito foi deixado de lado devido ao curto tempo que eles tinham pra finalizar o jogo.

A história é bem simples: o protagonista Ranger (dublado por Trent Reznor) é enviado através de um portal para acabar com um inimigo chamado "Quake". O governo estava fazendo experimentos com tecnologia de teletransporte e desenvolveu um protótipo funcional chamado "Slipgate", e o misterioso Quake comprometeu o Slipgate ao conectá-lo ao seu próprio sistema de teletransporte, usando-o para enviar esquadrões da morte para a dimensão humana em uma tentativa de testar as capacidades marciais da humanidade. O único sobrevivente da "Operação Contra-ataque" foi Ranger, que deve avançar em sua missão sozinho.

Entre as armas de Quake estão: Machado (1), Espingarda (2), Espingarda de Cano Duplo (3), Metralhadora de Pregos (4), Super Metralhadora de Pregos (5), Lançador de Granadas (6), Lançador de Mísseis (7) e a Lança Raios (8). Apesar das armas estarem organizadas por ordem de dano causado, algumas são mais eficientes contra certos tipos de inimigo enquanto outras causam menos dano. O retrato do personagem, algo que tinha muito destaque em Wolfenstein 3D e Doom, perdeu um pouco de espaço aqui e virou apenas uma imagem estática mostrando o status atual do personagem.

Os Power-Ups estão divididos em categorias: 3 kits médicos que recuperam 15, 25 e 100 de saúde, 3 armaduras nas cores Azul (absorve 30% do dano causado e dá 100 pontos de armadura), Amarela (absorve 60% do dano causado e dá 150 pontos de armadura) e Vermelha (absorve 80% do dano causado e dá 200 pontos de armadura); e os 3 ícones Quad Damage (aumenta em 4x o dano de todas as armas por 30 segundos), Pentagrama da Proteção (deixa o jogador invencível por 30 segundos e mostra o número "666" no campo de Armadura) e o Anel das Sombras que dá invisibilidade por 30 segundos.

São 13 tipos de inimigos presentes em Quake, entre eles cachorros, soldados armados, cavalheiros com armaduras e espadas, peixes, zumbis, fantasmas e o que mais você imaginar. Assim como acontecia em Doom, se você causar dano em algum inimigo e sair correndo da sala, eles vão se atacar entre si até que tenham matado uns aos outros - e conforme citado anteriormente, cada inimigo leva mais ou menos dano dependendo da arma utilizada em combate, então é uma boa estratégia memorizar qual arma funciona melhor contra quem.

As músicas do jogo foram compostas por Trent Reznor, vocalista da banda Nine Inch Nails. A música tem um estilo meio ambiental, bem diferente de trabalhos anteriores feitos pela empresa, adicionando uma atmosfera única ao jogo. Um dos "easter eggs" do jogo é justamente uma homenagem à banda de Trent, visto que nas caixas de pregos o logo "NIN" foi inserido em referência a sua banda.

Além do modo Single Player, Quake trás 2 modos Multiplayer: "Cooperative" no qual é possível terminar toda a campanha solo jogando com até 3 amigos e a maioria dos quebra-cabeças já estão resolvidos, não há necessidade de procurar por chaves e no final da fase há um grande anel para que o jogador não saia de fase sozinho. O elogiado modo Deathmatch, que são mapas exclusivos paca combate em LAN ou na internet através do QuakeWorld. O modo foi tão elogiado que Quake é considerado por muitos o primeiro jogo com características de E-Sports.

Seguindo o lançamento da versão original de Quake, a id Software desenvolveu o GLQuake que foi lançado em 22 de Janeiro de 1997. Essa versão utilizava gráficos 3D renderizados em tempo real e foi desenvolvida pensando nas novíssimas placas de aceleração gráficas 3D, uma nova tendências em computadores na época que foi vista com grande entusiasmo pela id Software, que inicialmente teve que trabalhar o jogo inteiro com um gráfico mais opaco devido a falta de um hardware 3D para deixar os gráficos mais limpos. Em 11 de Março de 1997 foi a vez do WinQuake ser lançado, que adicionava o suporte à Windows 95.

Como todo jogo de sucesso na época, Quake recebeu versões para consoles caseiros que traziam suas próprias características, porém a versão definitiva certamente é esta para PC, um clássico que sobreviveu o tempo e se mostra bastante aproveitável mesmo nos dias de hoje. Se você quer jogar a experiência original sem nenhuma espécie de auxílio externo ou Source Ports, NÃO compre esse jogo no Steam! Apenas a versão original roda e sem músicas! Para jogar o jogo é necessário instalar outras engines OpenGL como o Quakespasm e baixar as músicas da internet. Se isso não for um problema pra você, pode comprar sem medo, mas caso queira jogar a versão original em OpenGL sem muitos problemas, é melhor comprar o jogo no GOG.

37967070.review: Let me start off by saying that getting this game to look nice and run on a current computer is a HUGE pain in the butt. I am a huge fan of getting games to look their best so the amount of time it takes to get this game running nicely can really turn a person off and give up all together. BUT without the headache that is outside the game itself, the game is pretty fun. Quake is a run and gun FPS that anyone can have fun with. This game is very casual as you run through shooting demons and blowing everything up with the numerous amount of guns. Of course, this game is old so I will not hack on the graphics at all but I will say you get used to it after 10 minutes (especially if you did what I did and made the resolution better). Only thing that makes this game a little hard to play is the no soundtrack. Yes, I know that you are able to put one using outside methods but the fact that it doesn't come with one can be annoying for some. Also, there is a good amount of levels but not enough different enemies so you kinda see the same enemies throughout the whole game. One last thing is the game DOES NOT autosave so you have to manually save it (guess who learned that the hard way?). All in all, learning about the lore of Quake is a little interesting and playing an old game once in awhile is kinda my thing, so if you're the same way, I would say give it try.

37800897.review:
Над завязкой сюжета заморачиватся не стали она была взята из Doom, как всегда мы безымянный солдат боремся с неизвестным врагом который из-за ошибки учёных обнаружил землю и насылает орды своих воинов туда через телепорты. Как и завязка сюжета большинство орудий стирания врагов перенесли из Doom, так что если вы знакомы с Doom то играть вам будет конфортненько и уютненько, однако двухстволка здесь не столько эффективна как в Doom.

Впереди нас ждет 4 эпизода по 8 уровней в каждом и по 1 секретному уровню в 1 эпизоде то есть 32 уровня из них 4 секретных. В игре в начале каждого эпизода игроку предлагается карта и враги в футуристическом стиле, однако завершаться эпизоды картами и врагами в стиле тёмного фэнтези. Что намой взгляд является очень хорошим плюсом игры, жаль что в следующих частях это не используется. Сам генплей не претерпел больших изменений нам по прежнему как и в Doom надобно искать выход и ключи на уровне попутно сокращая популяцию местных обитателей. Враги абсолютно новые уникальные поскольку их нет в следующих частях Quake. С большинством врагов проблем не будет, но есть пара тройка врагов над которыми придется попотеть. Особенно запомнился Spawn, сам монстр не имеет ни огромного здоровья ни огромного урона зато имеет повышенную скорость и прыгучесть да еще после смерти взрывается. Поскольку я в юности много играл в 2d долго не мог привыкнуть к 3d миру из-за чего много раз ему проигрывал. Вот на протяжении 21 лет мне этот Spawn снится в ночных кошмарах.

В Quake была проведена id Software работа над ошибками что в итоге сделало игровой процесс приятней и очень удобным. Теперь чтобы присоединится к серверу или другому игроку в многопользовательской игре не надо капатся в файлах игры, надобно лишь зайти в игровое меню и ввести ip адрес сервера, друга. Сейчас многим молодым геймерам покажется смешным что я выдаю это за плюс, но тогда это было очень приятным нововведением что позволило еще большему кругу людей не заморачиваясь играть по сети. Сам движок Quake был уникальным и инновационным для игровой индустрии в те времена, он использует текстурированные полигональные модели вместо спрайтов, тем самым реализуя полностью трёхмерный мир, вместо двумерной карты с информацией о высоте также имеет проработанную на то время физику. На деле это позволило игроку свободно целится и перемещаться по карте (прыгать, плавать в воде).

Неописуемый восторг игроки испытывали тогда играя в Quake, множество игроков проверяло кто точнее ведь компьютер больше не помогал целится. Отмечу еще что баги практически отсутствуют несмотря на то что игра  делалась для старых ОС, стабильно работает на современных ОС. Если вы хотите посмотреть с чего началась эпоха 3d игр то вы выбрали правильную игру.

Итог: геймплей 12/12, Музыка 9/12, Сюжет 8/12, Концовка 10/12

37775651.review:
In 1996, even at 5 years old, I was introduced to Quake. It was burned into my mind from watching it; from the 3D visuals, sounds of and atmosphere of the world & the rush of speed! I had seen Doom and Doom II around that time, but Quake was unlike anything I had seen before on the computer outside of kids software. A world of fantasy and horror that made my little brain obsess and fear Quake. 

Forwarding years later It can be said Quake even by today (2017) is still a ton of Fun. It's a Fast & Moody Shooter that takes wits and quick reaction time. Although the game isn't as scary to me now as it was then, there is something to be said about Quake's world that feels strange & out of place, encased in darkness and dread that still lingers since 96. Quake to me is a game that still fuels my obsession playing it and it holds true to the legacy Id software had brought with it. 

I'd fully recommend this version as most of the old physical copies (mostly the Mission packs) have issues on later systems and hardware (That ain't Win95!) may require 3rd party software to run. But for the Steam ver. it's just a simple download, that's it!
So If one has never played a shooter, Love Doom and Doom II, or are tired of the bleak modern military wantabe shooters, Quake+Mission packs I & II is great option. An awesome & classy shooter that kickstarted the 3D FPS craze!

Note aside: Really hoping for a new Quake game in the style of the single-player in this game with Ranger, much like how Doom 2016 reboot did, just putting out that suggestion...

37724373.review:
The original Quake is an awesome shooter. A must-play for fans of the FPS genre alongside Half-Life and DOOM. The lovecraftian aesthetic and design for the monsters and levels is very unique and creates a unique, almost horror-like atmosphere that blends very well with the frenetic, high-octane shooting. 

For the Steam version of this game specifically, I would say buy on sale (it usually goes for a buck). The reason for this is that you're buying an outdated version of GLQuake which has a lot of notable issues, particularly the inability to increase resolution past 1920x1080 and the inability to adjust FOV, which can be frustrating since you'll have to tinker with it for a while just to get it to run outside of a blurry miniscule window.

Definitely buy it for the data files and ID1 folder so you can bring it into a more modern Quake engine and you'll have a blast!

《雷神之锤1》，第一次玩是小学一年级，说到这里不得不感谢我的父亲，盗版碟是他买的，游戏是他安利的，这也是我那奔腾586少有的，能完美流畅运行的3D游戏
记得当时玩的时候，央视正在热播电视剧《长征》，所以玩的时候，耳畔总会响起那句歌词“一送里格红军 介支个下了山“，满满的童年味道啊。

抛开情怀不谈，作为一款在DOS下运行的游戏，它在当年可算是无比惊艳了：
+多种可拾取武器
+创意十足的怪物造型
+颇具特色的黑暗系风格地图
+每个关卡有隐藏区域，同时可选三个难度，具有一定挑战性
+支持多人模式

另外有些细节也是令人眼前一亮的，比如枪械射击产生的火花，敌人受到攻击时的喷血效果等等。

这是我人生中接触的第一款FPS，当年可是会被一个场景困一下午啊，现在一下午怕是可以通全难度了，得意之余不免有些感伤

游戏技术成熟了，也侧面证明我长大了。

36625841.review:
Antes do review, uma recomendação: BAIXE A DARKPLACES ENGINE. Depois de instalar o quake, você faz o download da Darkplaces e extrai na pasta do quake, e tá pronto o sorvetinho. Essa engine moderniza totalmente o quake pra rodar em resoluções modernas. Além disso, é possível baixar packs de texturas HD e 4K e deixar o Quake com gráficos incríveis (requer um PC foda pra fazer isso). A darkplaces também mostra lobbies multiplayer pra você achar servidores pra jogar online, facilitando a sua vida. É uma revitalizada muito boa pro Quake.

Ok, então, todo mundo conhece Quake, eu espero. 

Após o ESTRONDOSO sucesso de Doom 1 e 2, a ID Software apostou em um FPS totalmente 3d e extremamente frenético. O singleplayer do Quake já oferece horas de diversão devido aos vários segredos que você pode encontrar, mas a parte que realmente consagrou o jogo foi o multiplayer, que fez o Quake ser considerado o pai do arena shooter e do fps online moderno. Mods como Quake World Team Fortress (exatamente o que você está pensando, o primeiro Team Fortress era um mod pra Quake), e Action Quake (possivelmente o avô do Counter Strike), criaram uma comunidade muito fiel. A própria Valve se baseou na engine do Quake para criar a Gold Source, a engine do primeiro Half Life. Quake também foi possivelmente o primeiro game a ser jogado competitivamente, sendo possivelmente o primeiro e-sport.

Very small community if you want to play multiplayer but if you want to explore mods and single player campaigns this game has a lot to offer. Mods are still being released for this game 20+ years after it's release. In single player and especially multiplayer this game provided the framework and set the bar for the golden age of FPS games. Quake World Team Fortress (the original Team Fortress) lives on thanks to a small community that refuses to let the mod die.

36094199.review: vkQuake (rename vkQuake.exe to Winquake.exe so you could play in Steam) + vispatch + fog 0.04 + r_wateralpha 0.5  + host_maxfps 250. Use command-line options -zone 2048 and -heapsize 192000. Don't forget to copy the original NIN soundtrack to Id1\music. Finish the game and try frikbot_quickstart.zip for some bot action. Then play the two official mission packs. Now you are ready to download even more high quality single player mods! This game has been around for so long, you wouldn't know where to start. Finally, just for fun, why don't you dabble in some private modding and/or mapping yourself? By that time you'll love the original Quake without any doubt in your mind that this is one of the all time classics.

35753224.review:
Ah, the original Quake. How could I say anything bad?
...Without pissing off millions of 90's gamers?
Yes the original has it's flaws and might not look super pretty today, but you know what? There's these magical things called MODS. I reccomend Darkplaces. The child of Doom would have to be fast and fun though. And this game is PERFECT for speedrunners. Full of dastardly traps and evil wall-mounted nailguns, this certainly has more advanced and challenging level design than Doom, but it still doesn't need an automap. Wierd.
Story: I love this game's Lovecraftian backstory. 4.5/5
Graphics: Might not be the prettiest girl at the dance (or the nicest) but she's like wine. Age doesn't really give a sh*t. Although the graphics do lack variation. It's just brown and grey, brown and grey, brown and grey. Ah well, it was revolutionary in '96. 3/5.
Gameplay: Like I said, perfect for pros, evil for newcomers. It took me FOREVER to learn how to strafe jump, no thanks to the half-assed "tutorial" in Quake Live. 4/5.
Music: Wuzzat? There's music? Hang on, lemme launch Darkplaces. There's a wierd glitch with the entire classic quake trilogy; the music hardly ever plays. Mods have an odd affinity for re-enabling it. And WOAH, NINE INCH NAILS MY MAN! Trent Reznor did a great job with the atmosphere, although I wouldve preferred the kinda music they had in the DLC missions. Trent also voiced QuakeGuy, AKA Ranger. Neat. 4/5.
Total: 15.5 / 20.
77.5%.

35240688.review:
QUAKE ist ein First Person Shooter und ein weiteres Meisterwerk von ID Software.

Die Grafik ist einfach grandios und heut zutage immer noch recht nett anzusehen. Aber bei so einem Spiel ist die Grafik aus meiner Sicht komplett nebensache. Das Gameplay liegt einfach im Vordergrund!

Das Gameplay ist ein typischer First Person Shooter mit Schwerpunkt auf Movement. Verschiedene Waffen, Pick Ups und Gegner treffen im Laufe der Episoden auf einen. Mit diesen Waffen macht man den Gegner die Hölle heiß und ballert was das Zeug hält. Aufgrund dieser gewaltigen Action macht dieses Spiel einfach nur Spaß und das Movement fühlt sich einfach fantastisch an. Gefolgt von der Letzten Episode kommt ein wie soll ich sagen eine Art Boss Gegner den man aber mit einem einfach Trick sehr schnell erledigen kann.

Alles in allem ist QUAKE ein wahnsinnig guter FPS und emphele einfach nur jedem dieses Spiel auszuprobieren!

35213792.review:
quake is pretty much perfect even 21 years after release. Everything that can be said about this game has been said and I would say if you want to know the details of the gameplay/history to watch Ahoy's and Gggmanlives's videos on youtube, so I will just give you some of my thoughts. *the hours is inaccurate as I have run the game mostly outside of steam with quakespasm*

pros:
-excellent visual design and castle/lovecraft atmosphere
-superb sound design, aside from shotgun
-very well laid out levels
-distinctive and strategic enemy types
-very smooth movement and controls
-distinct and fun weapons
-rocketjumping
-bunnyhopping
-it's quake


cons:
-single barrel shotgun sounds muffled and sad + too high firing rate
-strafe jumping isn't nearly as effective or easy as in quake 2+
-not enough ammo for nailgun/lightning gun in my opinion
-could use more enemy types
-no level select feature, but that can't be expected of a game from this time period
-the multiplayer, in my opinion, which appears to be in the minority, is not as strong as the singleplayer. The weapons are horribly unbalanced; the rocket launcher and lightning gun are very overpowered. Compared to quake ii/iii, there is just a very high chance that you will die within 1-3 seconds. It is also very difficult to find servers nowadays for obvious reasons, and it is a hassle to actually get to the servers, as quakeworld is not functional in the vanilla steam version.

compared to other games/quakes:
-I would say that Quake is equally as good if not better than Doom/Doom 2, as the full 3D environment allows for a greater depth to the shooting experience, although the decrease of size of the levels and the reduced enemy counts does make for a slightly slower experience
-Quake 1 is vastly superior to Quake 2 in terms of the visual design and layout. It has much more variety in terms of the visuals and the horror atmosphere is more memorable than Quake 2's repeated sci-fi environments. I feel that the dynamic between the different weapons is better because of the faster switching time, and the reduced ammo count requires you to be more thoughtful in your choices. However, I have not finished Quake 2 so I cannot really compare them accurately. And don't think that Quake 2 isn't also a very good game, because it is.
-Quake 3 is multiplayer only, so you can't really compare the singleplayer aspect of Quake 1 to Quake 3, but the multiplayer in Quake 3 is just simply vastly superior because the weapons are actually balanced, and it is just overall a more refined experience.
-I would say that overall of the first 3 quakes Quake 1 has the best singleplayer and Quake 3 has the best multiplayer, with Quake 2 sitting in the middle, although it is still a very good game and you should play it as well.

other stuff
-If you want to play Quake 1 in a higher resolution, you should download Quakespasm. In my opinion it is the best source port as it is fast and mostly unchanges the graphics.
-As others have stated, the steam version does not come with music, but you can very easily download it from the internet and load it from quakespasm
-if you want to play multiplayer, you should get nQuake
-A new quake game called Quake Champions was recently released and is in early access beta now on Steam. It is basically Quake 3 but with better graphics as well as the addition of Champions, different character classes that change the health, armor, and speed values of the player and add a special abilities such as teleportation or invisibility that changes the dynamic between players. I have not played it but it is generally considered to be very good, although there are some network issues at the moment, and if you want to play quake multiplayer today I would say check it out.

35118946.review:
After 20 years, Quake is still a blast to play. Most of my playtime has been via the QuakeSpasm and DarkPlaces source ports,  so my Steam stats hardly reflect my experience with Quake.

PROS:
+ Fast and very fluid action.
+ Incredible level design that has aged like a fine wine.
+ Creepy Lovecraftian aesthetic and atmosphere.
+ Killer NIN contributed soundtrack.*
+ Among the very best single player experiences in gaming, ever.
+ Online multiplayer is STILL supported over twenty years later thanks to fan run servers.
+ Very LOW hardware requirements: netbooks, cloudbooks, streambooks...runs on anything.
+ Linux and Mac compatiblity via source ports like QuakeSpasm and DarkPlaces.*
+ A steal at only $5.

CONS:
- Steam (includes GLQuake) version lacks the versatility of popular source ports.
- Steam version has no Mac or Linux support.
- Steam version has no 'toggle' option for mouse look.

*Soundtrack can be ripped from the old CD ROM version and copied to id1/music, but must be renumbered to begin with track02.

*Simply copy the files from the id1 folder in Quake to the id1 folder in QuakeSpasm or DarkPlaces. Same with hipnotic (Scourge of Armagon) and rogue (Dissolution of Eternity).

35096278.review:
Quake improved on every aspect on ID's previous title Doom. It introduced a generation of gamers to fully 3D environments, balanced and fair monstrousities, a great selection of memorable weapons, and dark lovecraftian atmosphere.

Quake has a unique asthetic that is missing from modern games. The feeling of dread and evil that is unlike the colorful demons of Doom or Painkiller. It feels fresh in 2017.

The gameplay is polished. The arsenal of weapons is polished. For example the super nailgun is great for Shamblers. The super shotty is great for going 1v1 with Fiends. The best weapons are the granade and rocket launchers though. Enemies stagger when hit hard enough. Something that some games just fogot about entirely. A reaction to being shot.

There is no hand holding, but the game is not hard. I've finished it on Hard difficulty and could probably go back and play though on Nightmare.

The only issue is its presentation on Steam. It is missing the iconic Nine Inch Nails soundtrack and you may have trouble playing the game on modern systems. The steam version could use some love.

Lets hope that this classic gets a remake like Doom did.

34770546.review:
大家好我是个热爱fps游戏的年轻人，对于我而言游戏对于我来说没有时代性，我更喜欢追求一些小众而经典的大作，有时候会偏向于一些日式少女rpg，我这个人一般不会去跟风，但是偶尔会暴露一点优越感，但是我向往纯粹的意境 一款好游戏在我的世界里没有剧情，只存在某个维度的世界观中不表露的无尽幻想中并伴随着疯狂杀戮或者暗夜中的空寂与星界暴风雪中的少女的在追求着那些没有死亡与衰老的终结是什么 并伴随着永不停息的痛 和暮光 或者是在安逸的城堡中度过这一生无穷无尽的生活 或许追寻仙境的天空之城在没有支柱的天空之桥上看着那些蒸汽火车在云层缓慢穿梭 这既是体验过程的意境（相信每个人脑海深处都会有那个模糊不清似梦境中的那些跨维度的世界意境与感动）（可能与本游戏没有太大关系，抱歉！跑题了）

             当一些人接触到一些老游戏的时候，很多人都接受不了这种模糊像素风，还有这种鸡肋的操作，我只想默默说你们太年轻。我可以不吹不黑的说这是我一生中玩过最好玩的fps动作射击游戏。我本身是个老卡的铁粉丝，之前一直在玩DOOM的所有系列 当我玩起quake让我感觉这个真正意义上的3d射击游戏才是真正的fps的教父 比起前几作的doom系列 id真的是在这个游戏上用心了 就这款游戏来说 没有绚丽的宣传画没有繁琐的剧情，所有的东西只需要自己来想象就够了，这个游戏可以无需任何剧情任何独白 让你体验到这个游戏的黑暗 和那层层背后的罪恶与痛苦。在疯狂的杀戮中可能一直到结局在想我是干什么 我的目的什么 我为什么而活着 这个世界是什么 ，这就是这个游戏的游戏性，老卡的年代并不注重剧情，这就是为什么后来竞技场的开发光荣成果，但是对于玩家来说这种单调而无任何浮夸长篇叙事的剧情，既是悬念的升华，粗略地介绍一下游戏背景，在这里透露一点剧情，地球被来自另一个维度的世界生物所攻击，把地球人都抓走并杀戮，其中作为游戏主角的幸存者无名战士，开始这复仇之路，游戏刚开始的建筑风格很好接受，走出传送门左右一些电子器械元件组成的墙壁 金属制成的自动铁门，和那些变异的特种兵和警犬 感觉应该是在某个太空或者某个星球的科研基地（在一些科幻电影中多数可见）随着关卡的走动 可以到建筑画风越偏中世纪风格，还有一些女性被怪物强暴的建筑雕塑 那些变异的罗马士兵 有种复活的存在。在这里我说一下我对这个游戏世界观的看法 我个人认为 他这个世界官存在属于那种不死生物生存的维度 既是地狱，这个空间维度存在很多年以前从恐龙世纪到人类文明的出现，把人类与动物的遭遇将会被传送到个维度空间（例如灾难，死亡，或者一些人类事物奇异的消失）在这个牢房中被侵害，杀戮、或者成为奴隶。记得doom4的重启之作，剧情讲的是在某个维度空间里（地狱）这个地狱中既是无数恶魔生存地，传说中远古地狱中有三大元素幽灵，  其中DOOM（主角）就是这个三大元素幽灵之一，他既是恶魔恐怖的存在，因为某些势力对立，带着仇恨屠杀了大量的恶魔，惊动了高阶恶魔，最后把他封印起来（具体怎么封印的 说封印的不清楚）。之后回到人间这边 UAC一个全球最大的垄断市场的与科技开发公司，在火星上开发资源的过程中在地下深处无意中发现了一个古老的仪式浮雕碑文，他们开始研究这个仪式，之后一个叫奥利维娜的一个生化人（恶魔的契约者）她发现了时空门，打开了通往地狱的传送门，发现地狱里有一种名叫类亚金源这种能源，开始利用地狱这种高风险的工程，来给人间运输资源，导致大量的恶魔从传送门逃出了，造成许多工作人员变异或致死，整个基地被恶魔占领，此时又一位叫海登博士的的高官，他读懂了地狱碑文，遇到用传送门把这个名为DOOM的人和他的铠甲传送到基地里，让他帮助他来消灭基地里的所有恶魔，说到这里这个名叫做doom的人，他是人类的躯体，这说明一个问题，他应该是曾经或是远古时期在人间被传送过去的一名士兵或者部落的战士，在地狱中他不但存活下来，并且磨练了一身的能力，地狱碑文上写道“他的灵魂被地狱之火烧出水泡，难以辨认，他选择了永恒折磨之路，他在无尽的怨恨中找不到宁静，他以沸血洗净了暗影平原，并寻找冤枉他的暗黑领主复仇”.
不确定quake和doom有联系，但是世界观是差不多的。
     废话不多说来说一下我对这个游戏玩过之后的亲身体验， 开局选择三个难度这个设计很有创意，每个难度的门都有一个传送门 而每个通往传送门的路径都是不一样的，简单难度是一路平坦 中等难度是遇道道连锁的桥下面是深渊 困难的难度是断崖下面是滚烫的岩浆 两边墙壁上悬挂着死尸 （象征着毁灭与恐惧）主角需要跳过这断崖来到传送门，到了第二层选择周目（大概就是游戏章节吧），更应有意思的是这个游戏是有地狱难度的，这个难度的传送门是在打完所有章节之后在第四章入口传送门说出下面的木桩高台上面（想走进去需要卡水池左下角落下回落到木桩上），之后向前走进入胡同里面你会看到一个布满岩浆的传送门。游戏操作性是横向操作视角 比之前doom的优势是关键时候可以用键盘来操作上下视角，在设计操作上这个游戏为之后的竞技游戏Quakecon奠定了基础，高操作性 如果你是个quake的老玩家，那你玩全懂这个游戏如何掌握节奏与技巧  。
      我在玩这个游戏的时候（中等难度）每次过一个关卡的时候都需要死掉无数次来熟悉这个地图和怪物出现的位置，还有刷子弹的位置和4倍伤害什么时候用什么枪比较好 ，这个游戏没有地图，我印象中玩的第四章地图的最后一关难的我想吐，前面打得都很顺利，最后去十字桥大厅拿蓝钥匙，那个桥跳到对面的岸上是有多难，（本人跳了无数次至于怎么跳过去不透漏），更意想不到的是，拿到蓝钥匙之后会到蓝门，但此时的蓝门在出生的那里在第二层，来的时候是从上面的洞口掉下来的，我怎么也没想到，我竟然是用火箭弹把自己炸上去的，（由于我查阅关于quake的操作基础，发现炮弹回位又称“火箭跳”的这个绝活）这就是以后的quake竞技场的大佬秀操作的东西了，这游戏有的时候需要计算血量和子弹，有的时候怪物并非需要清除在要过，我曾在某论坛上看过一个大神玩全quake ，他玩地狱难度每关大约40多秒左右就通关最多1分多钟，一路上基本不清怪，通过走位配合火箭跳直接走通关了，这期间度需要熟练地图以及怪物位置。非常需要操作的。
如果晕3D的朋友建议不要玩，这游戏3d场景失真，会造成极其不适用，甚至会比近几年的3d游戏还要晕。
废话不多说给这游戏打个分
游戏性方面我给满分（10分），解谜、跑酷、操作难度 
画质上：我给8分，虽然这种老游戏在那个年代算是高画质量的游戏，这种模糊的老画风，体现出那种恐怖猎奇的游戏想象，岂不是各有其独特
BGM：这里我给5分，虽然这游戏没有bgm，或许有它的风格，但是感觉如果加个诡异的bgm会很完美
操作上：我给7分:虽然不会让你上下移动视角，这里我说一下，这样的电影式视角会带来场景烘托感觉，上下视角的锁定完美的控制了这个场面，有些时候注意力刻意转移到某个无聊的角落个人认为很影响游戏的年代性的纯朴，但是有些时候需要上下视角变换的时候可以用键盘来操控，并不妨碍游戏体验。（我个人觉得）
整体游戏我给85分，对于老游戏 这是个相当可以的分数
（此稿纯手写，表达本人真实想法 无任借鉴和何复制文本资料，在文笔上 段落不通顺或错字的勿喷）

QUAKE is great, the game definitely deserves a place in my favorites. Recommending this to any fans of fast-paced shooters.

+ Fast
+ The level design is fairly straight-forward and it's not easy to get lost. Straight-forward is not to be confused with linear.
+ The collectable pickups required to progress through levels aren't hidden behind secret entrances or anything like that. None of the secrets are mandatory to find, which is great for people that just want to play through the game normally on their first playthrough.
+ Lots of ways to customize your game via options or console commands

- Poor port. You'll probably have to use a source port to make it running the way you want it to.
- The Steam version has no soundtrack (can be fixed via mods)

34682316.review:
Pour cette 100ème review postée sur Steam, il est temps de s'attaquer à un monument du jeu PC : Quake ! Réalisé par Id Software après le succès de Doom et Doom II, Quake représente une révolution dans le domaine du FPS. Le premier FPS entièrement en 3D c'est lui, la vue à la souris c'est lui ! Si Doom et Wolfenstein ont créé le genre, c'est bel et bien Quake qui va lui donner son visage moderne tout en confirmant les acquis des précédents jeux comme le support des mods ou l'importance du multijoueur.
Pour ce qui est du jeu en lui-même, pas de grandes nouveautés puisqu'il s'agit encore d'aller flinguer des monstres dans une succession de niveaux. Cependant Quake se distingue par une ambiance et une esthétique particulières. Le mélange entre bâtiments futuristes et gothiques ainsi que la bande-son lourde et inquiétante forment l'identité du jeu. Le level-design paraît simpliste de nos jours sachant que chaque niveau est conçu comme un petit labyrinthe avec clés à trouver et interrupteurs à activer. Cela étant, Quake ne laisse aucun répit et saura toujours vous accueillir chaleureusement en vous confrontant à des hordes de bestioles d'inspiration lovecraftienne totalement assumée.
L'histoire de Quake est marquée à la fois par l'ambition de ses créateurs, qui envisageaient un aspect RPG en supplément, mais aussi par les tensions entre John Carmack (responsable de la technique) et John Romero (chargé du design et des maps). Il en résulte un jeu à l'aspect un peu patchwork mais au gameplay malgré tout très solide.
En 1996, Quake est une véritable vitrine technologique, le moteur mis au point par Carmack étant capable de tourner sur de petites configurations mais également l'un des premiers à exploiter les puces 3Dfx pour un rendu incroyable à l'époque.
Bref, Quake est désormais devenu un mythe. Mais un mythe bien vivant ! Car jouer à Quake aujourd'hui c'est découvrir les 'source ports' (moteurs modernes permettant de faire tourner le jeu sur les PCs actuels) et les cartes créées par la communauté. Entre les moteurs visant la fidélité au rendu d'origine et ceux permettant d'améliorer les graphismes, il y en a pour tous les goûts. Quake a même reçu un épisode supplémentaire composé de 9 très bons niveaux pour l'anniversaire de ses 20 ans (rechercher 'Dimension of the Past' pour le récupérer) !
NOTE IMPORTANTE : cette version Steam n'inclut pas la soundtrack ce qui enlève tout de même une bonne part de la valeur du jeu. Pour en profiter pleinement, il faudra d'une part récupérer la bande-son sur le net et utiliser un moteur capable de lire les fichiers musicaux externes (rien de compliqué, il y a toute sorte de tutos pour faire ça).
MOTEUR UTILISE POUR CETTE REVIEW : QuakeSpasm

34622533.review:
So, it'll say I only have 5 minutes, but I'm using Dark Places, so my playtime is more than what it says.

Quake is awesome. I'll admit I wasn't a fan of it the first 10 minutes, but the game definitely grew on me. The atmosphere is fantastic, as most people say. The music is amazing, and definitely adds to the atmosphere. The level design is very good. The progression feels very natural, and I like that the levels teach you things in a controlled environment, and then provides more twists as the levels get harder. I also love the art style. As is with the music, it amplifies the atmosphere. The gameplay is some of my favourite ever. Also, get a source port, because the base game has a maximum resolution of around 600p (it's probably more than that, I'm just guessing.) With source ports you can play Quake at an HD resolution.

Yeah, the game is good. It's the game that ushered in the FPS genre. Before Quake, FPS games were Doom Clones. It's innovative, fun as hell, and it has a great atmosphere. Quake's one of the best of the best, in my opinion. Buy the game, it's only 6.50 CAD.

EDIT: I'm also going to mention a part of the game that stood out to me. In Quake, enemies take more hits to kill, with even the most basic enemy requiring 2 shotgun blasts before it's downed. This is in complete contrast to Doom, where the shotgun can obliterate hordes of enemies. Quake's weapons are far less satisfying to use. However, the enemies are far more rewarding to kill, because each enemy takes quite a few hits.

34585515.review:
Quake is so unfiltered and pure that it actually kind of makes me want to cry. 

You play as an, at the time, unnamed protagonist who was given the name Ranger by Quake III a few years later. After a horrible extra dimensional being known by the code name of “Quake” compromises human slipgate technology and uses to invade their dimension. It is up to Ranger, the only survivor of Operation Counterstrike, to travel to four different dimensions to collect ancient Runes and use them to put a stop to the extra dimensional invasion once and for all. 

I'm just gonna go ahead now and gush about this game like a teenage girl gushes about books about vampires and questionable morals. 

My first experience with Quake was back in the 90's when I found it on the Nintendo 64, safe to say, although still fun, it wasn't the best introduction to the series. I didn't really think about Quake again until a family member stabbed me and then used my computer to play Quake III. I remember watching while I was bleeding out and thinking “Oh hey, this looks neat.” 
I managed to get myself a copy of Quake 1 from a second hand store and my life was changed forever. 

The Steam release of Quake comes with both WinQuake and Gl Quake. WinQuake being the official source port for Windows, and GL Quake being designed for OpenGL and for things like hardware acceleration. WinQuake fought with me for a bit until I downloaded another Sourceport called Quakespasm and playing the Steam version through that instead of WinQuake. 

Everything about Quake just feels like a step up from Id's last few games. The graphics are better, the controls feel smoother, the enemies are 3d instead of 2d sprites. And the levels are clearly designed to take mouse support into account. 

The sound and impact of the weapons mix together with the animations of the suckers you're shooting at. Now enemies can be stunned for a short period of time as well as turned into meaty gibs from explosions are sometimes close range shots from your double barrel. 

The map design, in my opinion, is also a step up from Doom. Now less of a maze, they're much more straight forward and easy to navigate while not being a linear mess of corridors and checkpoints. Everything is expected to be handled by the player, as you're given the ability to save anywhere, basically making your own checkpoints. It was a main stay feature of shooters back in the day, but now it's actually a breath of fresh air compared to riddling the map with checkpoints like they do in newer games. 

Speaking of competent design, at the beginning of the game you're put into a kind of “Welcome to Quake” room. From here you're given three portals that work as your difficulty options, with the portals being marked as easy, normal, and hard. You can actually die choosing the Hard difficulty, considering they put a big pit of lava you have to jump over to get to it. It's really cool just how much attitude they use to put in games, you even have to hunt for the hardest difficulty since they hid Nightmare away somewhere in the episode select room. This game is just friggin cool. 

There are multiple ways to experience Quake, but the only console alternative is vastly inferior to it's PC counter part. The N64 version looks and plays like mud, and doesn't even have the cool difficulty select room. Source ports like GL Quake are vastly superior to the original MS-DOS version in terms of graphics and performance, and you can also find other source ports that modify the game in some way.
I would recommend Quakespasm, but you really can't go wrong with a bunch of them. 

Other than that, there's also Quakeworld, which is the official multiplayer source port for the game. There are also other mods such as the now legendary Team Fortress. You can still find a few people still playing either of these, and if you cant you can always just ask around, someone somewhere is always down for a bit of Quake. 

And if you absolutely just cant get enough Quake like I can't get enough expired prescription medication, then there are two official mission packs for Quake: The Scourge of Armagon, and the Dissolution of Eternity. 
Then when you're done with those, you can start hunting down mods for the game like the already mentioned Team Fortress. There's also Soul of Evil and it's sequel, as well as the newer Arcane Dimension. 

Do I have any gripes with the game?

Well for some reason, the Steam release of Quake doesn't have Trent Reznor's amazing soundtrack, and you have to mess with the game a bit to get it working. 

If by some chance you have never played Quake, then you should get around to doing so. You have absolutely nothing to lose and there are a ludicrous amount of ways to get your hands on it. 

Play Quake.

Quake gets a rating of Quake out of Quake. 

John Romero's first name is Alfonso.
