34549674.review:
[b]A heavily Doom-influenced game made by the same developer.[/b] This time around, the game's in full 3D thanks to its use of its new engine.
"Heavily Doom-inspired" being that it's pretty much the same game but in 3D; Satanic themed so you're up against demons of sorts, similar weapons, collect keys & such to open doors somewhere, episodic, and so on.

If you want to play this game properly on a modern system, you'll have to do a bit of extra work to do so. You even have to install the soundtrack for the game yourself as it's not included within the one provided by Steam.

There are 4 episodes with a total of 6-8 maps in each, counting the secret ones. The maps transition from sci-fi to medieval themed the further you progress an episode.

Not much to say to the game given its simplicity; the levels are short but neat, it's very dark, fast paced, and pretty fun. It's made darker thanks to the Nine Inch Nails music that originally came with this game. The soundtrack suited the environment and overall theme of the game, however I can't say the same for the fast gameplay since the music is mainly ambience.

This game was supposedly more popular because of the convenient multiplayer at the time, but I haven't tried it.
I personally find the Doom series to be a better series of single-player games but this is nice on its own.

34510359.review:
He aquí Quake, el hermano pequeño del mítico Doom.

Quake repite siendo otro [b] FPS fast-paced cargadito de violencia, armas, potenciadores y enemigos de lo más temibles.[/b]

Gráficamente, fue lo más puntero de su época. Y he de decir que no ha envejecido del todo mal, [b] para las limitaciones de su época, es increíble.[/b]  

Su único punto negativo es el uso de [b]la iluminación[/b], que hace que las sombras sean [b]totalmente negras y si se nos cuela un enemigo en ellas, no lo veremos[/b] (aunque esto más que un problema, lo veo un añadido de dificultad)

Quake opta por una [b]ambientación mucho más oscura[/b], de juego de terror. Sus escenarios y enemigos son mucho más oscuros en comparación a Doom.

[b]El gran problema que le he visto, es que todos los niveles parecen prácticamente iguales.[/b] En Doom, cada capítulo cambiaba enormemente los escenarios y nos hacía sumergirnos cada vez más en el infierno. En Quake en cambio, [b]el 90% del juego transcurre con esa ambientación de castillo medieval.[/b]

[b]El apartado sonoro también tiene un gran problema, y es que el 90% de sus melodias son susurros con algún grito.[/b] Entiendo que sea para reforzar la ambientación, pero es que [b]Doom 1 y 2 tenían unos temazos...[/b]

Jugablemente, Quake es un juego [b]más directo al grano, más centrado en la acción.[/b]

[b]Los niveles son mucho más cortos[/b] (tienen una media 5 hasta 15 minutos por nivel) [b]y no tan enrevesados.[/b]

Tendremos que seguir [b]buscando llaves para abrir puertas[/b], pero no estarán [b]tan escondidas ni habrá que buscar tantas[/b] (es más, el juego ni tiene minimapa).

Tiene el mismo número de armas que Doom, pero [b]las de Doom me parecieron mucho más variadas.[/b] De Quake me ha gustado el lanzagranadas, excelente para matar a casi todos los enemigos.

En cuanto a duración, [b]dura unas 4-5 horas, lo normal en aquel entonces.[/b]

Si planteáis compráoslo, [b]veo casi obligatorio instalarle el "Ultimate Quake Patch"[/b], ya que el juego de base, no alcanza altas resoluciones, viene sin la música incluida, etc...

Con ese parche, podréis [b]jugarlo en condiciones[/b] en PCs del siglo XX [b]sin perder absolutamente nada de esencia.[/b]

En resumen, no me parece mal juego, pero en general, [b]no me ha parecido un cuarto de lo memorable que se me hizo Doom.[/b]

34486028.review:
Quake is one of those FPS games that got my blood flowing and my heart beating. There's a twinge of fear throughout the game, especially if you don't know what's ahead. At first the game feels like Doom with the way you can literally blast your way straight through enemies such as Grunts and Ogres (okay ogres take a little more ammo to kill), but then you meet a Fiend and it lunges and eviserates your armored *** the first time you meet it. Okay, you have to be more agile and careful than in Doom. When you can kill one of those things effectively, you'll find that was only the start of your combative worries.
The feel of the game's design is like Hell, a Catholic Cathedral, and a poorly maintained sewer system (swimming is a big part of the game) having a threesome and a subsequent love child. Now that you have the image of that child in your mind, teach it Lovecraftian lore and give it literally hundreds of vicious monsters as toys. Watch it give most of those monsters weapons that seem a bit out of place now that I think about it, and scatter the remaining weapons and ammunition it had around the floor, and hide away some of that remainder in camoflaged closets for safe storage. That is in essence is what Quake is all about.

34445521.review:
Nutshell: 9/10 - Really nice classic game, graphics may be dated, but it sure is a fun game, just make sure to read through some of my fixes to common bugs.

Setup - 10/10 - Pretty simple, took, like, 2 seconds to install (50MB isn't exactly a big game, trust me 50MB was like 50GB back in the day, a lot of the simple stuff in this game were a huge deal back when it was released)  

Will it Run on My Computer? - 10/10 - As long as you use a windows computer, it should run, in terms of how hard it is to run, well, if your computer can run steam and view this review I'm writing, your computer probably can handle Quake.

Bugs - 8/10 - Easily fixable bugs, first thing, close out ALL windows and the steam program before playing (double click the desktop shortcut, don't click the "play" button in the steam program), it won't crash the game, but once you exit the game, you will find that you can't view any tabs that you left open, if this happens, just restart your computer and problem solved, it's an easily preventable bug so I'm not complaining too much.

Optimization - 9/10 - Only thing I think is truly lack of optimization is the maximum resolution this game supports (1024x768p, cheap laptop users rejoice because it'll look just fine on a 768p screen), it's not a problem, but it'll just look a little pixelated, this isn't a problem, it's just resolutions this low don't look great on 1080p monitors, or even worse, 4K monitors, if you got a cheap laptop with an only 768p monitor, I actually recommend you play it on that computer due to 768p looking better on a 768p monitor. another thing people might complain about optimization-wise is that you use arrow keys, esc, and enter to navigate the menu screen, and also that you cannot look up or down with the mouse (only side-to-side), but I won't count that as lack of optimization because back in the day this was completely normal and it would probably be buggy if you modded the game to use modern control schemes. 

Graphics - 7/10 - Yeah, graphics don't look great, but this was from 1997, back in the day, graphics like this were almost unheard of on PC, this game truly was an early pc-master-race game. 

Gameplay - 8/10 - On singleplayer, this game is just great, best 6-7 hours of gameplay I've had in a while. only thing I think you should realize, is the online community is DEAD, there is no real multiplayer anymore, to play online, you will need to have your friend come to your house, log their computer on to your wifi, then play a local server, essentially, the odds of finding someone else to play with are slim, and you should accept that.

Test of Time - 8/10 - So far, this game is exactly 20 years old, though it's graphics are REALLY dated, the game is still fun to play, so it scores well on the test of time.

Overall - 9/10 - Really good, you know a game is good if 20 years after release it's still fun to play.

34261681.review:
This game is one of the best games I have ever played and probably the best FPS I have ever played. The game is fast paced and challenging. The weapons are awesome (gotta love that super nailgun!) and I love that this game mixes scifi and fantasy! I really like how you first start from a scifi base and then go to medieval castles etc. and fight Lovecraftian monsters. This game also has a unique OST that is ambient and creepy and it fits perfectly to this game (but the steam version doesn't include the OST which is stupid but there are guides to how to get it). There is also multiplayer but I have only played it for a couple of minutes with my friend so I can't really say anything about it. There are also 2 expansion packs for this game and they are really good so I recommend getting them. I also recommend you getting a mod called Arcane Dimensions that adds hours of content to this game! I also recommend that you get a sourceport for this game because the game becomes much more enjoyable and the Arcane Dimensions mod doesn't work without it! I use quakespasm sourceport. The only downsides to this game are the bosses. They are kind of meh and there are only 2 of them.

Overall I would say that this game is a masterpiece! 10/10

34225936.review: Correva l'anno 1996, quando usci quake, mi ricordo che nel mio pc non funzionava perchè non era dotato di "coprocessore matematico" sto parlando di "intel inside 386 dx 40mhz", come quake molti altri giochi non giravano, "doom", "heretic", "hexen" ecc. La prima volta che ci ho  giocato è stato nel computer di un mio amico, con processore intel inside 486 dx2 66 mhz e girava con  una scheda video della cirrus logic - vesa local bus, con 8 mb di ram installata nel sistema. Installato il demo del gioco, appena abbiamo aumentato il detteglio iniziava a scattare. Quake girava con motore "Quake Engine"  sviluppato apposta da id software appositamente per questo gioco,  chiamato a volte pure  "idTech 1.5 ".  Per avere la massima potenza di quake a livello grafico,  bisognava installare delle apposite schede video di supporto ad essa già installata, sto parlando di "matrox m3d", "diamond monster 3dfx", "creative 3dfx voodoo 2" ecc,  perchè esse utilizzavano le "Opengl" dopo di queste sono uscite schede video con delle patch apposite per questo gioco ed altri, posso citare fra essi la "Creative 3d blaster pci 4mb", "matrox m3d mystique" e via dicendo. Questo tipo di schede video non avevano bisogno di schede di supporto; cambiato computer ed aver passato da un 386 ad un amd 486 dx4 100 mhz, il gioco girava sempre a dettaglio standard con una scheda video "trident ", però bisognava sempre installare una scheda video di supporto ad essa. E posso dire che mi sono divertito a giocare a Quake, ecco perchè secondo me chi colleziona titoli del genere non dovrebbe mancare anche se sono passati anni dalla sua uscita.  Si possono dire tante altre cose su questo titolo, però mi fermo qui.

34161730.review:
Ahhh, the memories.
Interestingly the game holds up pretty well today thanks to executables that run on modern systems and have been slightly improved over the original releases. But that doesn't man the originals were inferior back then.
I played it with fitzquake and everything run fine. For the mission packs I'm trying darkplaces and it seems to make the game look a bit nicer.

Lengthwise the game is a bit short. You could play it in one day or two, but that's not a bad thing. It was simply how these shooters were back then. Story-driven shooters came later and Quake has no story to speak of. The real story is running through the levels while fighting off monsters.

Gameplay is fast, guns are varied so that you can sometimes employ different tactics. Well, "tactics". At least you don't shoot the same gun all the time.

One thing to consider is what Quake accomplished. Before Quake there was no proper 3D shooter. Doom ws 2.5D. Quake is real 3D just as the games today. It this context this was a milestone. And considering what other games, series, mods etc. it spawned it is like THE grandfather of FPS. And he still kick your ass.

34065553.review:
Quake – шутер от первого лица, который расскажет историю о совершенно не легкой судьбе одного безымянного вояки. Проснувшись от безумного крика нашего командира, который требовал от нас возглавить операцию по возмездию “Контрудар”, ничего не понимая, мы лишь выкрикиваем: Сэр! Да, сэр! Прослушав короткий брифинг, становится ясно, что у ученых, как всегда, что-то пошло не так с телепортационными вратами и базу атаковал неизвестный враг, который получил кодовое название Quake! Поняв, кто именно стал причиной прерванного сна, мы перезаряжаем дробовик, берем в руки наш любимый топор и оправляемся разбираться с легионом смерти. Но удастся ли смертному найти и уничтожить тех, кто посылает все эти орды нежити? Сможет ли он закрыть эти врата? Уж одно можно сказать с уверенностью, без вашего присмотра у него ничего не выйдет. 

Что ж, это старая, добрая Квака, при виде которой, многие, одно время, считали продолжением Дума. Как стало ясно, это была совершенно новая игра, которую не обошел стороной энтузиазм молодых ребят, таких как Джон Кармар, Джон Ромеро и другие. Она стала первой трехмерной игрой в жанре шутер, которая действительно использовала данную технологию, а не псевдотрехмерность, как в Doom. В заслуги игры можно и отнести то, что с появлением Quake появилось такое понятие, как киберспорт. Многие люди проводили бессонные ночи, сражаясь с соседом, выясняя, кто же из них круче. Можно долго рассказывать, как много эта игра сделала для киберспорта, игровых технологий. Тогда был 1996 год, а сейчас (на момент написания обзора) 2017, то есть, с тех времен уже прошел 21 год. Конечно, игра уже не принесет играющему тех впечатлений, которые получали мальчишки того времени. Это время уже прошло. Но, стоит все же немного написать за игру. Действия происходят от первого лица, мы пробегаем от уровня к уровню, при этом отстреливая толпы монстров, не совсем толпы, но их не мало, уж поверьте, попутно собирая ключи к дверям. Окружать нас будет в основном готический антураж, а также не стоит забывать все прелести 3D технологий. Пускай они не такие, как сейчас, но все же намного приятней, чем в первых частях Doom’а, оторванные головы больше не будут всегда смотреть в вашу сторону. 

Возможно, мне бы стоило упомянуть за русификатор, но в игре всего пару строк текста. Но, если же вам все же хочется поиграть, видя при этом русский интерфейс, вы всегда можете открыть руководство к игре и найти его там. А вот о чем действительно стоит упомянуть, так это о музыке. Пускай она не такая как во второй Кваке, но все же без нее теряется весь колорит игры. Так что, снова открывайте руководства или ищите в интернете Ultimate Quake Patch v1.11 и будет вам счастье. 

Маус одобряет! =)

33940624.review:
Ever since I played Shambler's Castle for Doom 3 I've been thinking I could go for more of that. I have not been playing Quake in steam so ignore my hours.
The original game and the old engine? Revolutionary at the time, whew, pretty dated now. And it is lacking easy customization and some out-of-the-box options. Got questions? There are great guides on steam by Johnny Law. I went with this (which uses the Darkplaces engine):
http://www.moddb.com/mods/quake-epsilon-build/downloads
http://www.moddb.com/mods/quake-hd-pack-guide
I pulled the reshade and id 1 files not in epsilon from the hd pack and stuck it with epsilon, worked great. Possible I made some conflicts but I haven't noticed any problems. All I did besides that was tweak the reshade to my taste. There are more vanilla engines/looks if that's what you want, and they look and run nicely from what I've seen. HD Quake is nice and easy to set up thanks to these mod packs. 
Music is easy enough to find, different solutions are around the web. With darkplaces at least, you can just have ANY ten .ogg files in a folder named music inside id1 as long as you rename them track02 to track11. 
Quake really is a classic. Loaded with atmosphere and great levels, lots of custom maps. Its a great deal for the regular five bucks but goes on sale semi-regularly. If for some crazy reason you are on the fence, the epsilon build is packed with the shareware levels. If you missed Quake for whatever reason, do yourself a favor and give it a try.

33934230.review:
What do I need to say that hasn't been said before?

Quake is the GOAT when it comes to PC gaming, and lots of the aspects that exist today in PC gaming started here, and the most important one is the use of WASD keys and the mouse for movement. What game doesn't use those at all? Also, machinima got it's start here as well, not the horrendous YouTube channel, the movie form of where you use the game engine to create a film. The first machinima, "Diary of a Camper" seems pretty dated, and it's short, but it paved the way of the various Garry's Mod and GTAV videos you see today. If you are interested here's the link to the video on YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mq4Ks4Z_NGY

Even though the game is old as your grandma's perfume, it still kicks ass. The music is missing, though, which is a bummer, but the reason why it doesn't work is because the disk for Quake also functioned as a music CD. There are some guides you can find to properly mod the music in.

This game even still has online support, but good luck in trying to find any servers, let alone any with actual people on it. I have trouble finding people in Quake 3, which is legendary in the online. LAN support will work if you have friends to play with.

Other than those issues, the game still rocks like it did back in 1996:  fluid action, satisfying weapons, and retro graphics that, after over 20 years, aged perfectly.

This is a must own for anyone who uses a computer, and if you want something to run on a potato, this game will work great on there.

33813386.review:
4 ans après Wolfenstein 3D, 3 ans après Doom 1 et 2 ans après Doom 2, id Software sort en 1996 un 4ème jeu mythique en 4 ans et qui finit de définir les codes du FPS après en avoir posé les bases avec les titres précédents.

La nouveauté, c'est d'une part qu'on peut maintenant sauter et regarder en-haut et en-bas et d'autre part que le level design propose davantage de verticalité.

Les contrôles sont personnalisables, simples et intuitifs.
Pour les tirs, il y a une visée automatique sur le plan vertical.

Le jeu est divisé en 4 chapitres (qu'on peut jouer dans l'ordre qu'on veut) au début desquels on repart avec l'équipement minimum.

Sinon on retrouve divers ennemis avec des caractéristiques particulières, plusieurs armes, des couloirs sombres et labyrinthiques, des ascenseurs, des canalisations, des bassins dans lesquels plonger et nager, des objets (équipement, munition, medikit) à récupérer, des portes secrètes à découvrir, des pièges à éviter et des clés à obtenir pour progresser.


C'est un régal de parcourir les différents niveaux, d'explorer tous les recoins à la recherche des secrets et de faire face aux ennemis qui surgissent  parfois en nombre sans prévenir.

Je recommande chaudement à tous ceux qui savent faire abstraction des graphismes très pixelisés.

33716984.review:
В самой первой части игры, наш герой — безымянный солдат, получает на рассвете приказ командира защитить базу от коварного вторжения через телепортационные врата «Slipgate» врага. По сюжету игры, ваша задача - возглавить операцию «Контрудар», зачистив территорию врага, его уничтожить.

В целом, игра включает в себя 28 уровней, которые разбиты на 4 эпизода. В дополнении к этому, есть 4 скрытых подуровня, которые надо еще найти в секретных местах. Каждый эпизод игры начинается на космической военной базе, в режиме альтернативной реальности со «средневековым» колоритом, наш герой выполняет поставленные задачи.

Кроме того, что надо уничтожить всю космическую нечисть, вам предстоит находить скрытые в тайных местах полезные предметы, необходимые для продолжения игры – аптечки, броня, биокостюм и кольцо теней, делающее игрока на время невидимым для врагов.

Так как, почти на протяжении всей игры вы будете находиться, в мало освещённых темных помещениях, вам придется внимательнее приглядываться к окружающей обстановке, дабы не пропустить проход или тайную дверь. По завершению каждого уровня, вы сможете лицезреть статистику своего прохождения, с количеством уничтоженных врагов и добытых секретов.
Самое интересное в игре – это, конечно же, монстры, которых целых 13 персонажей, и два главных босса. Каждый, по-своему, имеет свою «фишку» и манеру поведения.
1. Солдат. Почти нестрашный зомби первого уровня с кислым выражением рожи, вооруженный дробовиком, легко убивается с помощью топора, если вы с ним в схватке «один на один».
2. Ротвейлер. «Милый» песик, выстрелив в которого несколько раз из ружья, вы спокойно можете идти дальше. Только будьте осторожны – прыгает собачка, как обезьяна.
3. Энфорсер. По-нашему телохранитель, который носиться вместе с солдадами. Укомплектован тяжелой броней, скафандром и энергетическим бластером. Сразив его, вы получите в награду рюкзачок, с патронами для молниемета.
4. Пиранья. Слабенькая рыбка, но в принципе, если в стае сородичей, может загрызть до смерти.
5. Огр. Хмурый и огромный людоед, бросается гранатами во все стороны, но легко уязвим.
6. Рыцарь. Быстро передвигается, от чего – опасен. Лучше бить его издалека, иначе в ближнем бою доставит много хлопот.
7. Колдун. Летающая тварь с обрубками вместо рук. Сразу его заметить трудно, маскируется хорошо, но издает звуки которые вам помогут не попасть под шквал зеленого цвета соплей, которыми он плюется.
8. Демон. Горбач, с рогами на голове. Быстро носиться из стороны в сторону, а ближнем бою практически неуязвим. «Валить» тварь надо на его замахе, иначе отвернется.
9. Зомби. Труп, разбрасывающий свою вонючую плоть по сторонам. Любит поджидать свою жертву в темных углах и коридорах. Приглядываемся внимательнее и палим из ракетницы.
10. Рыцарь смерти. Стреляет веером лучей, что очень неприятно.
11. Сгусток. Зеленая тварь, непонятного содержания, атакует всегда неожиданно и наносит смертельные раны.
12. Шалрат. Белая тварь, истошно орущая мерзким голосом, стреляющая самонаводящимися звездами смерти.
13. Шамблер. Монстр, внешне напоминающий Йетти, огромных размеров с когтями, отнявший ни одну жизнь у противника.
14. Хтон, первый босс. Ждет нашего героя в конце первого эпизода. Нереальных размеров монстр, швыряется огненными шарами лавы.
15. Шуб-Ниггурат. Последний враг в игре. Спокойно себя чувствует, потому что практически неуязвим. Только он не знал, что если в него телепортироваться, мало ему не покажется, что и сделал наш герой, порвав тварь на куски.

This is an incredible game that has recently been besieged by upset Call of Duty gamers in the review section.

If you're going to purchase a game made in the 90's and play it on an Operating system made after 2000, either prepare to use a search engine called Google or go back to the console where you belong.  

Many are complaining about no sound, that's because back in the day, they had these things called CD's.  At the time, every computer a thing called a CD-ROM drive to read them.   The music came on that CD-ROM disk and played as an audio cd when the game was being played.

Fast forward to 2017

In 2017 there's this amazing technology called Google.   Using it will unlock the solution to this problem.  It's called Darkplaces, it adds the music, which you're legally entitled to since you own the game, back to the Quake game.  

Dark Engine will play the https://www.quaddicted.com/files/music/quake_music.zip quake soundtrack if you put it in the proper folder.

Fast Forward 2033

To the people writing negative reviews on this game because of the lack of audio:   No they still haven't evented a computer that can poop for you yet.

33610752.review:
Quake is, obviously, a good game; a downgrade from the unfettered design genius of Doom 1 and 2, practically the Super Mario Bros 1 & 3 of old-school first person shooters, but what it lacks in perfectly timeless enemy & level design it makes up for in sheer atmosphere; whereas the atmosphere of Doom was an over-the-top heavy metal song, Quake is a dark, atmospheric and moody Nine Inch Nails album... quite literally; the soundtrack was, after all, made by Nine Inch Nails. These kinds of unique artistic statements are what indie devs behind such obnoxious "retro-style" FPS games as Strafe and "GUN GODZ" (all-caps, for extra zaniness!); games which replicate only the dated blockiness of the graphics for vapid "such a geek" ironic appeal.

So why am I downvoting this? Well, putting it simply, this version offers far less content than the fan-made QuakeSpasm engine; the latter makes the enemy animations more fluid, offers more control options and, above all else, actually allows you to hear the iconic NIN soundtrack assuming you have the audio files on your computer. Not only does it offer less options overall, the Steam version failed to include one of the most important and memorable aspects of the game - because iD Software/Bethesda are just really, really poor and can't afford to license the soundtrack again, I guess? Regardless, I'm not paying for what is clearly an inferior product compared to what I can get with an ancient copy of the game run through a fan-made program, so I'll return this as soon as this review is posted.

The only issue I could personally find with QuakeSpasm was that, by default, the engine smudged up the textures into a disgusting mess; you can fix this by simply typing GL_NEAREST_MIPMAP_LINEAR into the console (`/~ key, or creating an autoexec.cfg file containing that exact command and placing it in the iD1 folder (or the main game folder, not sure)).

Yes, I HAVE had a bad day today, why do you ask.

33325775.review:
One of the first fully 3D FPS games, which set the standard and pioneered both singleplayer and multiplayer games and mods for years to come. The gameplay is composed of straightforward progression in unique and atmospheric environments with a set of fairly balanced weapons and enemies. The levels contain various secrets and puzzles, and tons of closet monsters, but despite its age Quake is still very enjoyable and playable with a modern client. If you are into first person shooters, Quake is a must playthrough at least once. There are also about a billion user made maps and mods for Quake, not to mention the multiplayer side of things which is still active. Highly recommended game! However the Steam version really needs to be fixed as you will need to do some messing around to get things sorted and working properly.

Steam version of Quake/Mission Packs do not include the soundtracks, for best single player experience you will need a more up to date singleplayer client like Quakespasm and to download the soundtracks elsewhere in OGG format. For multiplayer Quake use ezQuake client.

One of the best simple hard action FPSes of it's era. What's lovely:

33213957.review: QUAKE is certianly brimming with balls to the wall run gun fun, and it was on the absolute cutting edge of technology at the time, but it is noticeably unrefined. Compared with DOOM, which was also a huge technical achievement at the time, QUAKE feels simply unpolished and possibly unfinished. While the core gameplay is engaging and all the weapons feel good to use, the enemy designs lean more toward annoying than interesting and the later levels start to rely way too heavily on springing massive ambushes on you. However, the actual layouts of the levels stay intricate and aesthetically pleasing throughout, although the the pervasive brownness does eventually become fatiguing. All that said, in the end what seals the deal on this game's inferiority to DOOM, in my mind, is its lack of interesting boss fights. There are two boss fights in the game; at the end of Episode 1, you fight Chthon, who is beaten by pushing 3 buttons to electrocute him 3 times. At the end of the game overall, you fight Shub Niggurath, who is beaten by teleporting into her for what may be the first recorded instance of a telefrag. Historic though this may be, I can't help but notice that neither of these bosses are defeated by engaging them with the actual core mechanics of the game; and Episodes 2 and 3 don't even have proper boss fights, with Episode 2 opting to introduce a new regular enemy as a "boss" of sorts, and Episode 3 simply choosing to corner you between two fiends, forcing you to drop to an earlier part of the level in order to survive the ordeal and make your way back. Neither feels particularly climactic. It's these sorts of things that can make the difference between a truly satisfying and engaging first person shooter, and a pretty fun diversion to drop a couple hours on while listening to podcasts. I do recommend QUAKE on this basis, it's a very fun way to while away the time and keep your motor skills engaged while your mind is on other things, but don't go expecting a true successor to DOOM's legacy.

33187264.review:
[b]If Quake and Doom were people, they'd get married[/b]

Id's previous shooter may be much more legendary, and rightfully so, but it was Quake here that put the final nail in the coffin to so called "Doom Clones" and truly defined the FPS genre. Being one of the first, if not the very first, FPS to use fully 3D polygonal graphics, Quake took the storm Doom made and turned it into a hurricane. Valve's own GoldSrc engine being a modified version of the Quake engine, the game branched out to create more classics such as Half Life, Team Fortress, and then branched out of Half Life to create Counter-Strike, the creation of the Source engine, and Steam as we know it today.

[b]The Game Itself[/b]

Yes the version here on Steam doesn't have the original soundtrack, but all you really need is this patch here http://www.moddb.com/games/quake/downloads/ultimate-quake-patch-v1-11
Just run the exe and it should automatically detect the Quake directory in your steam files. It's just that easy. The Patch also helps re enable the Steam overlay and help adjust the resolution to your liking, so the game doesn't look like Notch ate Minecraft and vomited it all over your computer screen.

Quake is hard for newcomers,  and even as a seasoned Doom veteran I found myself shamefully walking down the Easy difficulty corridor before starting Episode 3. You will die. A LOT. Enemies aren't pushovers here, a tradeoff as the time Quake was released, fully 3D enemies in the same numbers as Doom's sprite based would've slowed the game to a crawl, if not outright crash it. Ogres will chuck grenades at you, Vores fire homing purple projectiles, and zombies will keep throwing an endless amount of damaging innards at you until you blow the undead buggers away with either a grenade or rocket launcher, or a point blank shotgun blast while under the effects of quad damage. Not to mention the Shamblers, which will make you retreat halfway across the map in an attempt to find cover if your health is seriously low. You will be forced to learn what weapon works best against enemies, lest you be stuck dying endlessly by the claws of a Fiend or the barb of a Scrab.

Quake is, and can be frustrating, but it is always rewarding.
Like Doom, even if you're not a FPS fan, Quake is still a game that anyone who considers themselves a gamer should play before they die.

Without the patch I linked above, the game is barely playable. Once you run it though and open up the game, it's back to it's old playable self, and a 10/10 experience you won't forget

In short, buy this game.

3- GLQuake (WinQuake'in aksine OpenGL rendering kullanıyor. En çok dikkat çeken özelliği bulanıklaştırılarak pikselsiz görünen texturelar. Ben şahsen Software Rendering'i tercih ederim. Ayrıca Windows 10'da sıkıntılı sanırım. Çok oynamak isterseniz ayriyetten source port yükleyin.)
4- GLQuakeWorld (OpenGL renderingle QuakeWorld)

Oyunun başka güzel bir yanıysa modları. Mod DB'ye girin dolu mod var. Bir kısmını LAN'dan oynayabilirsiniz. Quake Rally modunu tavsiye ederim.

33046702.review:
Quake is nothing short of a PC gaming landmark. There's a lot going on in Quake- it's the spiritual evolution of DOOM, a technological revolution on many fronts (including a game-changing 3D engine and online multiplayer system), a completely realized vision with industrial-gothic graphics and incredibly immersive sound design by Trent Reznor of NIN fame. Quake is an all-encompassing masterpiece. 

My tastes run more towards JRPGS and quirky adventure games, and I'm not a big fan of gore, but there's something about Quake's purity of vision and excellence in execution that has grabbed me since 1996 and refuses let go. Without hyperbole, this is one of the greatest video games of all time and its impact and influence continues to be felt to this day. If you're at all interested in game design or history, I encourage you to visit (or revisit) Quake. It is inspiring.

32997483.review: Still the number one game set in a flaming sex dungeon. Honestly, this game feels fresher now than it did when it came out - back then it had world-beating tech, but was basically just an ugly version of Doom for the average player. Since then, the amount that has been discovered about the engine has turned it into a totally different experience. Rocket jumps and bunnyhopping, two things that disappeared from gaming after the HL1 update that removed it from that game, are in full force here. Very few games since have successfully replicated the sheer speed of this ugly monster kink party. Even if you don't care about gaming history, you would be doing yourself a disservice to not check this out.

32821763.review:
Находясь вне дома уже которую неделю, но оставаясь при этом с ноутбуком и Интернетом, мне наскучило лазать по дебрям Ютуба и ВК, и я решил поиграть. Но надо было установить что-нибудь быстропроходящееся и нежелезотребовательное. Нет, ноутбук у меня хороший. Но старику уже 7 лет и мне не хотелось его нагружать. Пошарив в своей библиотеке, мои ручёнки уставили курсор на Quake. Не знаю, почему он, а не DOOM. Наверно, потому что Думов три, а Кваков дофига. Когда же я запустил этот шедевр, меня оглушила волна ностальгии. Я 5 часов без перерыва не выходил из игры. Игра состоит из 5 частей, в первых четырёх мы находим руны, а в 5-ой убиваем главного босса, в данном случае, боссиху. Но 5-ая часть не в счёт, там просто несколько броневистых врагов, а с боссом даже сражаться не надо. К нему надо просто подойти и... финальные поздравления. И как раз-таки мне и не понравилось, что в игре нет нормальных боссов. Тот, что в конце - бездействует, а тот, что второй (да, их два) находится в первой части, и чтобы его убить, надо просто попрыгать по кнопочкам на полу, чтобы его током шандарахнуло. Ну, не буду говорить, что присутствует несколько типов врагов, оружия, среди которых гранатомёт, дробовики и т.д. Стим пишет, что у меня наиграно 5 часов, но игра проходится гораздо быстрее. У меня давно не было опыта с таким жанром, если он у меня вообще был. Единственная похожая игра, в которую я играл тогда это Дюк Нюкем (Серьёзный Сэм не в счёт - он более современен). 
В общем, я был рад вспомнить первый Квейк, который стал первой революционной игрой, после которой и начался создаваться жанр 3D-шутеров. Если хотите немного скоротать время, то можете его скачать. Игра весит всего 55 Мб. У меня она установилась за 9 секунд. У игры есть отреставрированная версия - GL, перед запуском лучше выбрать её, чем потом сидеть и пялиться на один мыльный пиксель на экране. И от себя добавлю, что мне капец неудобно использовать клавиши, чтобы посмотреть вверх или вниз. В Квейке можно поворачивать голову только по сторонам, а чтобы использовать вертикальную ось, то только клавишами, и если вы сделаете шаг вперёд или назад, когда пользуетесь осью ОУ, то камера сбрасывается, поэтому приходится побыть мишенью, пока нацеливаетесь на того, кто сверху. Ладно, хоть небольшое автонаведение есть, например, когда враг находится выше уровня вашей головы, и он в поле вашего зрения, то оружие стреляет не по центру экрана, а по врагу. Оценка: [spoiler]8.00 из 10.0.

32752491.review: Gonna be honest... While I'd still totally recommend this game, I don't find it as fun or interesting as either Doom or Wolfenstein 3D. Sure, all the essentials for a great classic FPS are there, such as exploration-centric levels, tons of different enemies, powerful weapons, and a good challenge, but the game doesn't present its essentials in as appealing a way as Wolf or Doom. Almost everything in the game is colored some variation of brown, there are an EXTREME lack of enemies for a shooter of this type, there's virtually no music at all, many of the guns sounds are muffled, and the enemy designs themselves aren't all that scary looking. While it's still just as energetic and thematically creative as Wolf and Doom, this one just doesn't feel as bombastic or exciting as those two.

This was the game that got me hooked on PC games back in 1996.  Back in a time when the graphics card only came out, this was the first game that you downloaded a plug in for and watch the magic happen and go from sprite graphics to fully rendered 3D.  My mouth dropped and said, this is the future of gaming!  Keep in mind, that was 1996 and a lot has changed.  A LOT!  After a breif play and tearing up some sweet nostalgia, I was shocked to hear that the audio in this game rocked, even by todays standards.  You can hear your rockets have impact, the creatures groans as you move about the map.  Like the audio effects are amazing for a game this old, it rivals even some modern games.  

This game is something that, if you want to have a good blast of the past, you owe yourself to pick up a game that revolutionised a generation.  If you were born well after 1996, pick it up to see what all the fuss is about.  I'll let you know one thing for sure, story wasn't a main theme with id games back then, so don't expect any. 32174153.review:
[b] Unique and memorable setting combining modern age and medieval times. There's not an ounce of happiness in this universe, just demon organs and especially brutal weapons. Grotesque and dark levels look and feel depressing, filled with monsters and very high speed gameplay. Quality shooter that was a step up from the already magnificient Doom. [/b]

[b] World of Quake [/b]

I still don't know do i like the world of this game or not. It's raw, the levels look all the same. A human military base at the beginning of each episode which houses a portal that takes us to medieval-themed levels. Castles and temples filled with secrets and monsters that kill you in matter of seconds. All my "problems" with this game are just in the overall look of the game, and they're just preferences. This world just isn't my thing, everything else is spot-on, though the lore is a bit too similar to Doom. Instead of hell, this time we're facing a mysterious hostile creature codenamed "Quake", and his army.

Levels are again like mazes with their complex layouts, filled with secrets. 4 episodes featuring 7-8 levels consisting of clever level design, arena-like open areas and tight, twisty corridors, underwater areas, jumping traps and various enviromental traps. If you have played the original Dooms, you have an idea about the levels. It's just taken a bit further here. Every episode has a secret level, accessed through a certain secret from the normal levels. Secret levels also have some distinct gameplay mechanics, like low gravity. 

One fun thing about choosing the difficulty that i have to mention: Instead of choosing it from the menu while starting a game, we begin the game by facing three portals labelled easy-medium-hard. But there's a fourth one, the hardest difficulty is actually hidden. I always found it a fun remark, you're already facing a puzzle even trying to find how to play game in the hardest possible difficulty. Whoever came up with that, my hat is off to you, sir.

[b] My itchy trigger finger [/b]

Gameplay itself is fantastic! Especially on the harder difficulties the enemies put up a good fight (but not enough, since they're all dead now!). Controls respond tightly and weapons offer a lot of variety. Every weapon is needed, you won't survive with just running around with the machine gun, err, the nail gun i mean. 
Like in Doom(s), the ammo is scarce, that alone forces you to use different weapons all the time. No regenerative health, no covers, only skill. Remember watch out with your grenade launcher, they really do bounce off from walls. Easy to clear corners with and even easier to commit a suicide, especially in hectic moments. 

Overall the weapons feel brutal and powerful, making the action feel fun and enjoyable to play.  The aforementioned nail gun for example. It's a completely different thing to fire a submachine gun compared to an high powered nail gun spitting out big sharp nails. As a melee weapon we have an axe and the lightning gun is amazing. Mowing down the hordes as the BFG does, if not even faster. Blast from the shotgun sound and feel heavy, nails hurt and grenades devastate everything around them.

Bosses are also a bit different, there's usually a certain mechanic involved rather than purely shooting them to death. There isn't those epic fights with a boss in this game, they're over quick and usually they're just standing still. Another thing that i'm having mixed feelings about. It's very anti-climax when you finally reach the boss after slaying hordes of demons, but on the other hand, it's a nice twist and something else than the usual shootout.

[b] Actual footage! [/b]
Gameplay can be found here, contains very clear spoilers. 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=X6idrg7eLNk&list=PLSkXIDuUIe6LnER6C-FjLsyc8aNFO4YqQ

Don't mind my minutes on steam. I played this through Zdoom, and with graphical mods. It's old, the vanilla looks horrible. It didn't look that good even back then. So do yourself a favor and get the  graphical mods if you play this.

[b] Should you buy it? [/b]
YES! it's one of the classics that defined modern shooters. Doom started it, Quake 1 made it better. If you are a fan of fps-games, you have to have know Quake.

Quake is good, through and through, but it's not my favorite game ever made. If you're into video game history than this is the game for you. In this game, you not only see what is one of the first games to feature 3d real-time rendering but also a step up from Doom when it comes to the action. Speaking of Doom, this is almost the same game, except with mythological monsters and EPIC weapons. There are still demons, yes, but most of that has been thrown of out of the window and replaced with some of the best entities to ever exist! Also speaking of video game history, this game lead up to the creation of the GoldSrc (GoldSource) engine, which powered Half Life!

If you liked the action in Doom and the feel of it, get this game. It's an amazing game for its time and it's still great today. The only thing I have to compain about (much like everyone else) is that there's no soundtrack whatsoever! You had one job id Software! One Job!

31863158.review:
Quake is one of the best FPS games I have ever played. The levels are A M A Z I N G (beside for some in episode 4, imo.) and the weapons are pretty cool, although they have some flaws. (DISCLAIMER: I played through Quake using a source port called Quakespasm. I highly recommend it, as it adds higher resolutions and better control options. It also has compatibility with almost all custom levels. If you want to get Quakespasm, go here ( http://quakespasm.sourceforge.net/download.htm ) if you want to fine-tune Quakespasm to get a more vanilla-esque experience, go here ( https://steamcommunity.com/app/2310/discussions/0/350542683187454090/ )) With that out of the way, let's begin the review. The textures in Quake are bland. They kinda forshadowed the brown shooters we'd have in the 21st century, but don't let that turn you off of the game! Despite the bland textures, the levels themselves have very distinct and high quality atmospheres. You know you're in a hellish, Lovecraftian medieval world with knights and gargoyle-like demons chasing you. The enemies are pretty great, except for the Fiend, which is pretty annoying. The weapons look cool... but they don't feel great. Enemies just bounce back a little when they're shot, and the weapons sound a little... soft. Nonetheless, the weapons are awesome. The super nailgun is great, the rocket launcher is legendary, and the arc gun is absurdly powerful. 

PROS:
-You get to choose what episode you want to play, in a single playthrough!
-The weapons are great
-The atmosphere is unique and great
-The enemies look cool
-Each episode is unique
-The levels are so much fun to play
-The "music" is good
CONS:
-The weapons FEEL lame
-Enemies just kinda bounce back when you shoot them

9.5/10. Pure amazingness. I was disappointed when I beat the game, because I wanted more. The mission packs are fun, but not nearly as great as the original Quake levels. Not as good as DOOM 1 and 2, however. But that's just my opinion.

31835097.review:
I haven't even finished the game yet and I have nothing but good things to say about this game. Well, except for perhaps two drawbacks: 
The usual FPS styled controls are clunky in this. You can pretty much get the same experience as you would with Halo or Call oF Duty, etc, except that you can't move to aim with your mouse vertically (horizontally is fine, though), unless you always hold down a "mouse look" button, in which case you can aim your camera in both the x and y directions. Just as long as you hold it, and I've had to give my hands a rest because of that.

Also, even though there are instructions and guides onto how to get the music running in this game, I still can't get it to work even after I followed the instructions perfectly. This is an older game, so it's music apparently runs directly off of a physical disc, or something like that. Not sure what it is exactly, but if you are ready to deal with either going great lengths to get the music or play a game without music, then I suppose this is something that can be overlooked. Just a bit disappointing.

Now onto the good things:
THIS GAME IS INSANE.
I've never been into FPS games, but this is something that truly stands out to me. Not only is it intense, but it's also creepy as hell and extremely original design wise. The levels are really fun, and the monsters are truly original. The whole theme of it stands out. You can tell that Id had put a lot of effort and a lot of love into making this, and even being from 1996, this game stands the test of time and I can guarantee you that you won't be disappointed. The graphics are respectable and the programming is great, and even when you fight the enemy soldiers with guns, you can actually avoid being shot by them (it's not just that they shoot you and auto hit), unlike most similar games from this era. Even if you aren't into FPS games I recommend this game. Absolutely I do.

31370074.review:
You have just discovered the daddy of all true 3D shooters.  It's primitive compared to today's games.  The graphics are from a simpler time - a time when game play ruled and stories were for children.  It's not pretty.  No... It's dark, brutal, and unapologetic.  It will rip out your gaming spine, chew it up, and spit it back in your face.  There's no hand-holding here - no tutorials, no hiding behind things to heal - just an "easy" mode for those who don't know what a real FPS game is, and "Nightmare" for those that accept no compromise.  Out of ammo?  Look for some, or see how useless your axe really is.  You get hurt?  Find your own friggin' health box.  They're all gone?  Well too bad.

This is QUAKE.

Forget your 360 no-scopes.  Forget your controllers.  Forget your sissy regenerating health.  Forget your backup.  There is no backup.  It's just you against evil unleashed.  You will clench your mouse in fear.  Your knuckes will turn white scrambling for your strafe keys.  You will watch with utter horror as you find there is no substitute for skill, no mercy from your enemies, and nobody to hear your screams except your own twisted mind.

You think you know gaming?  You think you're hardcore?  Are you ready for four complete episodes of nightmare-fuel visions of Lovecraftian horror that will pummel your pride and assault your senses?  Are you ready to face Quake's fearsome hordes with nothing but your wits and your weapons to save you?  If you want to know how true gamers were forged, this is the anvil upon which they were beaten.  This is the crucible of champions.  It is waiting for you.

If you dare.

31108796.review:
[h1] 完整版	[/h1]：[url=http://www.g-cores.com/articles/24114] 开始于斧头砍狗，结束于殴打克苏鲁	[/url]

[h1] 我是罗梅罗指挥官，这是我在id最喜欢的锤子	[/h1]

关于本作拿的奖，影响的后世作品，对技术的革新以及两个约翰的打情骂俏，你可以在百度，百科，百雀灵说明书上面查阅到。这里面要聊的，是关于这个游戏玩起来怎么样的话题。

作为以“私自把马里奥移植到PC”开始的公司，id对早年的作品《指挥官基德》的发展还比较上心，“Quake”一词最早与游戏产生联系是在1991年，作为原定的《指挥官基德3》的一个草案出现。这个被称为“正义之战”的角色扮演游戏中，玩家扮演的角色就叫“Quake”的人，而他的武器则是一把现实世界中，罗梅罗在玩D&D时自创的强力武器(也叫Quake)。
由于id当时所使用的技术已经过时，因此不得不暂时放下这个计划，与此同时，卡马克也开始了关于某个第一人称地牢射击游戏的开发。直到1996年，id真正带来了全3D的图形技术，并开发出一款现代意义上的3D第一人称射击时，这个原本被作为罗梅罗私人专享的名词，再一次成为了游戏的主题。一般来说，Quake的剧情是这样的：一个被认为来自其它维度的，代号为“Quake”的敌人正在使用传送门侵入地球。玩家扮演的无名士兵(后来被称为“游侠”)，作为基地里唯一的幸存者，必须进入传送门，取得四个符文以击败对手。

那么好的，现在看来这是一个科幻风格，以外来生物入侵地球，孤胆勇士力挽狂澜的故事。但是我们来看看游戏中是什么样子。

每个四大章节中的第一关，是明确的军事基地装饰，敌人都是军人、猎犬等等这些被杀死后僵尸化的队友。而当玩家进入传送门后，关卡展现出来的却与“科幻”没有任何联系，你将会在包括哥特、地狱、中世纪风格的多种城堡或地下城中冒险。你的敌人也都是食人魔(但是装备了榴弹枪与电锯)、魔法骑士、僵尸以及各种无法描述的怪物。

跑错摄影棚了......？

原本的开发过程中，Quake上市后会是一个标准的奇幻风格故事：有剑士，有龙，有地下城与所有你能想到的传统角色扮演元素。
但在临近完工的几个月前，卡马克去掉了龙(后来在资料片中重新加入了），去掉了剑与魔法的武器系统，去掉了罗梅罗心爱的锤子，让这个游戏变成了一个极具迷幻错位感的诡异故事。

理所当然的，罗梅罗(又)生气了！当然这件事的影响，也是要到几年后才发酵了，而且也不再与这个游戏有什么关联。事实上，即便卡马克自己也曾经说过不在乎手头游戏的剧情，但也能在doom与Quake中看到id在这短短两年内的改变。

这点在初代尤为突出，每一个章节中，关卡结构与场景贴图都能够感受到，玩家扮演的陆战队员是不断深入的：从标准的科幻军事基地→遭到未知物质侵蚀的建筑→完全来自地狱的环境。

但在Quake里面，实际体会到的更多还是嗑药一般的错乱感觉，从本身就带有旧工业气息的第一关开始，到后来各种各样奇怪的建筑风格，游戏并没有给予你如何场景上的信息。唯一给我比较良好印象的，是玩家每次进入传送门后的第二关，会在传送门旁边看到一些来自地球的箱子，从这个细节来推论有先于玩家的人进入过这里，还搬了不少物资进来。

由于这种混乱，反而造成了Quake初代有别于后续作品，乃至多数游戏的奇怪，但又特别带感的个性。而且可能也是这种“随便啦没人在乎剧情！”的态度，这个游戏不仅有着传统奇幻的内容，还有许多来自于宇宙深处的不可描述之物。
在说明书上，你可以看到许多来自于洛夫克拉夫特小说中的名词，除了某个被称为“Tsathoggua ”外，许多关卡的名称也会让熟悉克苏鲁的玩家感到熟悉，比如无名之城，或者是别的打出来全都像是脸滚键盘一样的名词。
游戏只有两个BOSS，但是其来头却不小，第一章最后才岩浆池出现的家伙，其实就是“Chthon”，你无法用常规伤害击败它，而是要通过场景中的电磁机关的帮助。
而最后的BOSS并非我们想象中的，是那个神秘的最后的Quake，事实上这个东西根本就从来没有出现过。你要面对的，是大名鼎鼎的Shub-Niggurath，即莎布·尼古拉丝，抚育万千的森之黑山羊，生命母神。

嗯，其实也没啥，只是又一个证实再强大的邪神也比不上霰弹之神力量的案例。

没有什么游戏，能比Quake在难度，关卡选择上令我印象深刻：你从一个大厅开始，面前有三条通道，左边平坦而风格常见的是一条轻松愉悦的旅程；中间刻着恐怖浮雕的斜坡，则是一场带着刺激的冒险；而右边，被吊在墙壁上示众的失败者、喷洒的熔岩，都在警告你这个选择将是九死一生的挑战。
我至今都忘不了这个游戏这极富个性的难度选择方式，它带着游戏独有的抽象意境，让所有通过菜单选择的游戏相形见拙。而且最高级别的第四难度“噩梦”，居然还是以隐藏房间的方式进入的，更让这个设计充满了魅力。
你必须通过大厅分布的4个传送门，去取得各自的符文，才能让大厅中央最后的关卡解锁，去挑战邪神。
每一章节的序章都以基地、士兵与狗开始，而这些“正常”的家伙也仅仅能在开场给你提供一点热身，不像DOOM一样还会在之后遇到。
你有斧头和霰弹枪作为基础武器，枪械的打击感远胜如今部分后辈，尤其是士兵的反应和音效，即便蒙上一层层马赛你也能感受到它们的痛苦。
武器虽然都是枪械，但是却有着一种奇怪的复古、陈旧感，尤其是火箭筒看起来就像是一根烟囱，而两把机枪发射的也都是钉子。
双管霰弹的表现不如DOOM，虽然可以解决多数近距离战斗，但事实上Quake的世界中，火箭炮之神的影响力显然要更多一些。

相比DOOM，它要更难一些，比起那个用枪的地牢爬行游戏，Quake的战斗激烈度，敌人实力和关卡配置都要更胜一筹。
它的关卡设计仍旧保留着前者的风格：巧妙、险恶、充满了想象力与大量的秘密，每一关都能带给你不同寻常的感受。
但是它现在是全3D了，可以跳，有真正的高低概念，有更明确的物理效果，所以你不再仅仅依靠过去的谨慎与思考就能解决各种危机。
从这个游戏开始，各路操作大神便陆续被练出来了。
即便你不安装任何MOD，这个游戏都能玩出非常爽快惊险的战斗场面，敌人又多又硬，基本的攻击手段也很强悍，如果你玩的是“普通”以上的难度，那么后期被好几只强力怪物追着打的情况十分常见。

在所有游戏资讯网站，Steam商店页面中，只有雷神之锤的初代，才被归类到了“洛夫克拉夫特文学影响”，而之后这个系列再也没有涉足过该领域。
总之，这个系列中我最喜欢的还是初代，它有五寸钉打造的音乐，有无与伦比的难度选择界面，有真正开启“老炮FPS风格”的游戏规则，当然还有那随心所欲到令人无语的创意。

是的，当一群天才，用务实刻苦的心态，把自己笔记本上乱画的扭曲涂鸦做出来时，诞生出的是永远无法被超越的传奇。

31108583.review: An absolute classic that you should not miss out on, especially if you like id Software's other classic FPS games like Doom and Wolfenstein 3D. The only problem though is that I can't find a way to get the music working. But it's still enjoyable without the music.

31106937.review:
Tagliamo per una volta i giri di parole e andiamo dritti al punto: Quake rappresenta uno dei punti di svolta EPOCALI del gaming su PC, ed è il principale artefice del periodo di grandissimo successo che i FPS hanno conosciuto nella seconda metà degli anni '90. Partendo dall'esperienza maturata con DOOM, i geni della Id Software hanno sfornato un titolo di indiscusso spessore tecnico e profondamente innovativo a livello tecnologico (per gli standard del periodo), che merita a pieno titolo di essere annoverato tra le pietre miliari del genere.

In Quake vestiremo i panni di un soldato semplicemente conosciuto come Ranger. Una misteriosa entità aliena, nome in codice "QUAKE", è riuscita a sfruttare una breccia nel prototipo del sistema di teletrasporto sviluppato dal Governo, utilizzandolo per inviare i suoi squadroni della morte nella dimensione umana con lo scopo di testarne le difese militari. Come unico superstite dell'operazione "Counterstrike", il nostro compito sarà quello di mettere fine a questa invasione sconfiggendo "QUAKE", che durante la nostra missione si rivelerà come la mostruosa dea Shub-Niggurath.

Una volta selezionato il livello di difficoltà tra i tre disponibili (quattro se consideriamo il livello Nightmare nascosto), il gioco ci catapulta in una sorta di hub da cui potremo accedere alle basi militari che sorvegliano le "slipgate" di accesso alle quattro dimensioni di Quake. Ciascuna dimensione è costituita da un numero variabile di livelli (da 6 a 8) e custodisce al suo interno una runa magica: una volta raccolte tutte e quattro le rune avremo accesso al livello finale dove avrà luogo la resa dei conti con Shub-Niggurath.

Per capire davvero l'importanza di Quake è necessario ritornare per un momento al 1996. Sull'onda dell'entusiasmo suscitato da DOOM i FPS stavano conoscendo un successo senza precedenti, e il mercato era letteralmente invaso da una quantità di cloni basati sul famoso DOOM Engine di Id Software: tra questi spiccavano titoli come Heretic e Hexen, prodotti dallo stesso John Romero e distribuito dalla casa texana.
Il lancio di Duke Nukem 3D nel gennaio di quell'anno testimoniava che i tempi erano ormai maturi per un cambiamento nel panorama dei FPS. Per quanto però il titolo della 3D Realms garantisse un livello di interattività senza precedente e avesse un grande punto di forza nell'innegabile carisma del Duca, l'arrivo di Quake travolse tutti con una mossa tanto spregiudicata quanto lungimirante: il passaggio definitivo al rendering full-3D, reso possibile dalle grandi potenzialità del nuovo Quake Engine (realizzato INTERAMENTE da John Carmack mentre stava ancora lavorando al DOOM Engine).

I benefici di questa rivoluzione sono davanti agli occhi di tutti: architetture maestose, superfici verosimili e nemici che per la prima volta acquistano una dimensione reale e tangibile sono solo alcuni esempi. Il level design trae particolare giovamento dal passaggio alle tre dimensioni: le capacità del nuovo motore grafico permettono infatti di riprodurre in maniera realistica edifici dalla struttura altamente complessa come castelli medievali con ponti e fossati, basi militari su più piani, cunicoli acquatici dallo schema irregolare e tanto altro. L'ambientazione e l'atmosfera dark-gothic è resa in maniera magistrale e in particolare gli interni degli edifici, con l'alternanza continua tra luci ed ombre e un pronunciato sviluppo verticale degli spazi, trasmettono una sensazione costante di imminente pericolo.

Come in ogni FPS che si rispetti, anche in questo caso avremo a disposizione un nutrito arsenale di armi per fronteggiare le armate di Quake: si parte con un semplice fucile per passare a nailgun, lanciagranate e finire in bellezza con il potentissimo fulminatore (attenzione all'acqua!). Si poteva forse fare qualcosa di più in termine di varietà: nailgun e super-nailgun sono piuttosto simili se si esclude la frequenza di fuoco, e il fucile non è molto utile una volta trovata la doppietta (arma decisamente comune). Tutto sommato si tratta però di piccolezze, in quanto (quasi) ogni arma riesce a ritagliarsi il proprio spazio a seconda delle situazioni. Ad esempio il lanciagranate è un'arma tattica che ci permette di sfruttare i rimbalzi sulle pareti per raggiungere in relativa sicurezza nemici non immediatamente visibili, mentre il lanciarazzi si rivela altrettanto utile per colpire da lunga distanza aree più vaste e/o eliminare più avversari raggruppati grazie alle sue esplosioni.

Per quanto riguarda i nemici, è interessante notare la presenza di un buon numero di combattenti da mischia: questo aspetto rende gli scontri molto più veloci, rischiosi e impegnativi dal punto di vista tecnico, impedendo nella maggior parte dei casi l'utilizzo di tattiche "berserker" (soprattutto ad alti livelli di difficoltà) e imponendo di pianificare molto attentamente le manovre di avvicinamento e di attacco. Il confronto con i mostri più potenti come vore e shambler sono sempre molto difficili, ma con la giusta dose di reattività e sfruttando a dovere la struttura del livello non dovremmo avere particolari problemi (a meno di non trovarsi in inferiorità numerica).
Gli unici nemici veramente insopportabili e sbilanciati a mio avviso sono i maledetti spawn, le gelatine violacee che ci accompagneranno per tutto il quarto mondo, attaccandoci spesso in gruppi di due, tre elementi. Questi esserini malefici ci avvicineranno saltando come cavallette, schivando in questo modo buona parte dei nostri proiettili, e cominceranno a schiaffeggiarci violentemente una volta che ci avranno raggiunti. A questo punto saremo già praticamente spacciati, visto che una volta eliminati gli spawn esploderanno violentemente riducendoci in poltiglia nel giro di pochi secondi.

Dal punto di vista grafico, non possiamo ignorare il fatto che il 3D di Quake ha risentito pesantemente del passare degli anni: paradossalmente potremmo dire che il tempo è stato più clemente con DOOM o Duke Nukem 3D, ma questo è naturale conseguenza del fatto che il 2D ai tempi aveva già mostrato gran parte delle sue potenzialità, mentre il 3D rappresentava il bleding edge tecnologico, tanto innovativo quanto acerbo e inesplorato. Le tecniche di rendering e l'hardware attuali lo fanno sembrare un prodotto semi-amatoriale, ma nel contesto storico in cui è nato nessun gioco poteva reggere il confronto con Quake per resa grafica.
Sento di dover spendere qualche parola anche sul comparto audio: tutto l'audio di Quake infatti (compresa la voce del protagonista) è stato realizzato niente meno che da Trent Reznor, geniale e poliedrico frontman della band alternative Nine Inch Nail, vincitore nel 2011 del premio Oscar per la colonna sonora del film The Social Network di David Fincher. Si tratta di tracce in cui la musica lascia spazio ad effetti ambientali suggestivi e disturbanti al tempo stesso, avvolgendo il giocatore in un'aura di mistero che aiuta a mantenere alto il livello di ansia.

Sull'importanza di Quake, senza esagerare, si potrebbe scrivere un libro: basti pensare che se non fosse mai esistito in questo momento non esisterebbe nemmeno Half-Life, in quanto il motore grafico GoldSrc su cui si basa (progenitore del più famoso Source Engine) non è altro che una versione pesantemente modificata del Quake Engine. Non fosse altro che per curiosità accademica, invito tutti gli amanti dei FPS a provare almeno una volta nella vita questo gioco: Quake è una pagina della storia dei videogame che ogni gamer che si ritenga tale non può esimersi dal leggere.

31059784.review:
It's funny to think that without Quake the gaming industry would be much different.
Without Quake, Valve wouldn't have used its engine to create Half-Life
Meaning we wouldn't have the Hl mods that became games like Counter Strike
Neither would the Team Fortress mod exist meaning we wouldn't have its money printing sequel
We wouldn't even have Steam because Valve wouldn't have created Half-Life
We wouldn't have speedrunning, completionism, modding or machinima be as big in the gaming community.
So more than half of the gaming industry would be somewhat affected.

Just let that sink in.
By the way Quake is great you should play it, as well as 2 and 3.

31002806.review:
Going into this game for the first time ever was a rather an odd experience for myself. Pay in mind I played this with a source port called Dark Places.

Quake was a leading FPS for many things, in a way repeating what DOOM had already established but with the 3rd Dimension. Although I personally disagree because Quake is a good game don't get me wrong, but it's Single Player I felt was rather lacking in small little spots that sort of bugged me more than it seems for everyone else.

Generally speaking what bugged me the most was a lack of challenge with actual boss fights, not just jumping around pressing buttons and having some bomb just go inside the final boss then jumping through a portal to then just calling it a day.

Maybe I was more spoiled of content like DOOM, Duke Nukem 3D, Blood, and etc. But seeing as many people praising Quake I think they were praising it for other reasons or even just technical prowess.

Regardless at the end of the day I did enjoy Quakes Single Player Experience, the music was off the charts awesome (once I got it working like it should be), the Levels do give off a mix of DOOM and Hexen/Heretic, and the core gameplay is still fun. Although I personally recommend to try it on harder difficulties to give an additional challenge because some of the weapons in the Normal Difficulty can make it a little too easy.

People aren't just blindly prasing ID and everything they did just to praise them when talking about this game. Sure, it's "story" is practically nonexistent unless you read the manual (which doesnt come with steam release), but thats common for 90's video games. What your REALLY here for is action, and that is both fresh and plentiful in this game. Enemies are tougher than they are in DOOM, ID's previous game, and can take more hits, deal more damage, and are generally more vicious than before. 30645911.review:
As an enlightened, modern parent, I try to be as involved as possible in the lives of my six children. I encourage them to join team sports. I attend their teen parties with them to ensure no drinking or alcohol is on the premises. I keep a fatherly eye on the CDs they listen to and the shows they watch, the company they keep and the books they read. You could say I'm a model parent. My children have never failed to make me proud, and I can say without the slightest embellishment that I have the finest family in the USA. Two years ago, my wife Carol and I decided that our children's education would not be complete without some grounding in modern computers. To this end, we bought our children a brand new Compaq to learn with. The kids had a lot of fun using the handful of application programs we'd bought, such as Adobe's Photoshop and Microsoft's Word, and my wife and I were pleased that our gift was received so well. Our son Peter was most entranced by the device, and became quite a pro at surfing the net. When Peter began to spend whole days on the machine, I became concerned, but Carol advised me to calm down, and that it was only a passing phase. I was content to bow to her experience as a mother, until our youngest daughter, Cindy, charged into the living room one night to blurt out: "Peter is a computer hacker!"As you can imagine, I was amazed. A computer hacker in my own house! I began to monitor my son's habits, to make certain that Cindy wasn't just telling stories, as she is prone to doing at times.
After a few days of investigation, and some research into computer hacking, I confronted Peter with the evidence. I'm afraid to say, this was the only time I have ever been truly disappointed in one of my children. We raised them to be honest and to have integrity, and Peter betrayed the principles we tried to encourage in him, when he refused point blank to admit to his activities. His denials continued for hours, and in the end, I was left with no choice but to ban him from using the computer until he is old enough to be responsible for his actions.
After going through this ordeal with my own family, I was left pondering how I could best help others in similar situations. I'd gained a lot of knowledge over those few days regarding hackers. It's only right that I provide that information to other parents, in the hope that they will be able to tell if their children are being drawn into the world of hacking. Perhaps other parents will be able to steer their sons back onto the straight and narrow before extreme measures need to be employed.
To this end, I have decided to publish the top ten signs that your son is a hacker. I advise any parents to read this list carefully and if their son matches the profile, they should take action. A smart parent will first try to reason with their son, before resorting to groundings, or even spanking. I pride myself that I have never had to spank a child, and I hope this guide will help other parents to put a halt to their son's misbehaviour before a spanking becomes necessary.
1: Has your son asked you to change ISPs?
Most American families use trusted and responsible Internet Service Providers, such as AOL. These providers have a strict "No Hacking" policy, and take careful measures to ensure that your internet experience is enjoyable, educational and above all legal. If your child is becoming a hacker, one of his first steps will be to request a change to a more hacker friendly provider.
I would advise all parents to refuse this request. One of the reasons your son is interested in switching providers is to get away from AOL's child safety filter. This filter is vital to any parent who wants his son to enjoy the internet without the endangering him through exposure to "adult" content. It is best to stick with the protection AOL provides, rather than using a home-based solution. If your son is becoming a hacker, he will be able to circumvent any home-based measures with surprising ease, using information gleaned from various hacker sites.
2: Are you finding programs on your computer that you don't remember installing?
Your son will probably try to install some hacker software. He may attempt to conceal the presence of the software in some way, but you can usually find any new programs by reading through the programs listed under "Install/Remove Programs" in your control panel. Popular hacker software includes "Comet Cursor", "Bonzi Buddy" and "Flash".
The best option is to confront your son with the evidence, and force him to remove the offending programs. He will probably try to install the software again, but you will be able to tell that this is happening, if your machine offers to "download" one of the hacker applications. If this happens, it is time to give your son a stern talking to, and possibly consider punishing him with a grounding.
3: Has your child asked for new hardware?
Computer hackers are often limited by conventional computer hardware. They may request "faster" video cards, and larger hard drives, or even more memory. If your son starts requesting these devices, it is possible that he has a legitimate need. You can best ensure that you are buying legal, trustworthy hardware by only buying replacement parts from your computer's manufacturer.
If your son has requested a new "processor" from a company called "AMD", this is genuine cause for alarm. AMD is a third-world based company who make inferior, "knock-off" copies of American processor chips. They use child labor extensively in their third world sweatshops, and they deliberately disable the security features that American processor makers, such as Intel, use to prevent hacking. AMD chips are never sold in stores, and you will most likely be told that you have to order them from internet sites. Do not buy this chip! This is one request that you must refuse your son, if you are to have any hope of raising him well.
4: Does your child read hacking manuals?
If you pay close attention to your son's reading habits, as I do, you will be able to determine a great deal about his opinions and hobbies. Children are at their most impressionable in the teenage years. Any father who has had a seventeen year old daughter attempt to sneak out on a date wearing make up and perfume is well aware of the effect that improper influences can have on inexperienced minds.
There are, unfortunately, many hacking manuals available in bookshops today. A few titles to be on the lookout for are: "Snow Crash" and "Cryptonomicon" by Neal Stephenson; "Neuromancer" by William Gibson; "Programming with Perl" by Timothy O'Reilly; "Geeks" by Jon Katz; "The Hacker Crackdown" by Bruce Sterling; "Microserfs" by Douglas Coupland; "Hackers" by Steven Levy; and "The Cathedral and the Bazaar" by Eric S. Raymond.
If you find any of these hacking manuals in your child's possession, confiscate them immediately. You should also petition local booksellers to remove these titles from their shelves. You may meet with some resistance at first, but even booksellers have to bow to community pressure.
5: How much time does your child spend using the computer each day?
If your son spends more than thirty minutes each day on the computer, he may be using it to DOS other peoples sites. DOSing involves gaining access to the "command prompt" on other people's machines, and using it to tie up vital internet services. This can take up to eight hours. If your son is doing this, he is breaking the law, and you should stop him immediately. The safest policy is to limit your children's access to the computer to a maximum of forty-five minutes each day.
6: Does your son use Quake?
Quake is an online virtual reality used by hackers. It is a popular meeting place and training ground, where they discuss hacking and train in the use of various firearms. Many hackers develop anti-social tendencies due to the use of this virtual world, and it may cause erratic behaviour at home and at school.

The Singleplayer level design is built in such a way that it is always fun to explore. The levels are riddled with secret passages, areas and even secret levels. 30373361.review:
Historical Roots

The year is 1996. The games industry had already been presented to games like DOOM and Wolfenstein 3D but Quake take the experience of first person shooters to another level. The Game inserts you into an environment full of darkness and fallen demonic beings – all of them willing to kill you, off course. You walk – or run –  by yourself through dark and scary corridors solving puzzles, pressing buttons, dodging bullets and escaping from traps. Each new area guards a new surprise and, most of the time, you going to fell relieve when you find the last portal and complete the stage. 

Why play Quake nowadays? It’s simple, no one could truly respect the FPS genre without knowing his history and his historical development process. To play Quake is a prior condition for anyone who wants to set himself up as a gamer. 21 years after his debut the game remains fun and challenging – try the nightmare difficult – the sounds are iconic and, of course, the gameplay is remarkable. There’s no present without history and there’s no history without the present. Just play.

30283969.review:
Quake is a FPS game made by id software and released in 1996. it stood put among the FPS or "Doom Clones" at the time for a few notable reasons. It was fully 3D, had smooth animations and complex (for its time) level design. But how does it hold up? How does it play for a first time player? The awnser to both is amazingly well.

Game:
The game is set across 4 different dimensions. This causes each of the four episodes to have its own unique location. The weapons are plentifull and fun to use. The line-up includes grenade launchers, nail guns and a lightning gun. The only problem I had with the game was the two bossfights. They didn't require shooting, but pressing buttons. You may have to shoot you way to the buttons, but the bosses themselves doesn't require one bullet to kill, which really sucks. The games difficulty is on the heavy side. I played on normal and found the difficulty what I would expect on hard with other games. Respect to the people finding nightmare enjoyable and finishable..
Technical:
The game works out of the box with the steam version, but there are a few issues. The controls are not as smooth as modern FPS games. The soundtrack ran off a cd, that means no soundtrack for the steam version. the resolution is really low (Doesn't bother me but can bother you). To fix all three issues mentiones above (The only technical complaints I had) I used the Ultimate quake patch. It uses the DarkPlaces engine developed by LordHavoc, the plasmagun fix by OoPpEe, the music patch originally hosted on widescreengamingforum.com and the NSIS install system by Nullsoft. The Ultimate Quake Patch was compiled by (as I understand it) MenaceInc.

I would highly recommend this game to ANYONE!!

P.S. 
Don't forget to download episode 5. Its calles DOPA and was developed by Machine Games (Who did a amazing job with Wolfenstein the New Order and Wolfenstein the Old Blood) for quakes 20th birthday. It has te same old school design and if it was included with the original game, I wouldnt have know that it wasn't id that made this episode.I can't think of higher praise for DOPA. Get it if you get Quake. It was released for free. To install it you just have to create a dopa folder where quake is instelled, extract the zipfile in the folder and double click the batch file.

30282148.review:
[h1] The last game of id Software [/h1]

There were a lot of problems during the deveploment of Quake, which eventually led to John Romero (main level designer) being fired and several other members leaving the company. id Software died (well, a part of it anyways) and the repercussions showed up in 1997... But that's a story for another day.

Despite the chaos during deveploment, the game turned out to be pretty good, and in my opinion is the best game from the old id Software.

[h1] Unsettling [/h1]

Even for today's standards.

Seriously, this game has freaked me the f*ck out more times than what I would like to admit. The darkness of the environments and the deadly speed of some of the enemies (specially in Nightmare) really make this a pretty tense game.

And the soundtrack. God, the soundtrack. It makes you wonder in what horrible corner of existance you got yourself into. Unfortunately it isn't included in the Steam release (copyright or something I think) but this can be solved by installing the Ultimate Quake Patch or by downloading the .ogg files and using a source port. Don't you dare to play this without the music. IT'S A CRIME.

[h1] Did you say Nightmare? I don't see a Nightmare skill... [/h1]

Quake manual: "([i]Nightmare[/i]) This is so bad that the entry is hidden, so people won't wander in by accident.  If you find it, don't say we didn't warn you."

30184144.review:
THIS.

THIS FUCKING GAME.

If H.P Lovecraft, the heavy metal of the nineties, and the intense atmosphere of Doom was smashed, reconstructed, smashed again and reconstructed again into a glorious product, it would be Quake.
Unlike Doom, where it pitches at you various demons from hell, Quake throws in horrific eldritch beings in their place. We still have the loveable zombies from the last game, but instead of Cacodemons we have Scrags. Instead of Revenants, we have Vores. Instead of Cyberdemons, we have Shamblers.
The weapons have changed as well. Instead of fists, you get a bloody axe that is more useless than trying to cut down a tree with a herring. The Pistol has been ditched for a Shotgun, which is unfortunatly not as fun to use as Doom's shotgun. The Super Shotgun returns as well, and it somewhat becomes a mainstay later on ingame. Instead of a chaingun, we get the Nailgun and Super Nailgun, which are FUN AS HELL TO USE. One new addition is the Grenade Launcher (Which bizarrely shares the Rocket Launchers ammo pool), which can take out groups of bad guys in no time. Theres not much to talk about the Rocket Launcher, aside from its amazing "Rocket Jump" capability. Finally, we have the Thunderbolt. Think of this tool as the games version to a Plasma Gun/BFG 9000 combo. It does not have much ammo, so use it in the most lethal of situations. 
The game has such a forboding atmosphere, at times I felt as though something would actually sneak up on me and rip me to shreds. Combine it with the soundtrack made by Nine Inch Nails, and this game will make you feel more nihilistic than the ending of the first F.E.A.R. 

Tldr;
BUY THIS GAME, OR I WILL FUCKING RAPE YOUR DOG IN THE DEAD OF NIGHT. I AM NOT KIDDING. BUY THE GAME RIGHT NO

30106406.review:
,, DOOM , перенесенный в полное 3д " 

Первый Quake - довольно знаковый для меня шутер . Он был моим первым шутером , который я опробовал ( хоть в далеком 2001 , так и не осилил его и сразу же забыл  название ) . И вот спустя каких-то жалких 16 лет я вернулся к нему , чтобы ,, исполнить долг " и пройти его на Кошмарной сложности . 

Начинается игра оригинально - мы стартуем в неком хабе ( если его можно так назвать ) и нашему взору предстает 3 коридора . Каждый коридор - олицетворение уровней сложности ( от чистенького Easy-коридора  до покрытого лавой Hard ,( в котором спрятан Кошмарный уровень сложности ) . На выбор нам дают 4 компании , проходящих в мирах , захваченными полчищами именуемыми ,, Quake " . 
Чуть позже к игре вышли два адонна ( Scourge of Armagon и Dissolution of Eternity ) . Каждый привнес немного новых врагов / оружия  и около десятка уровней со своей стилистикой . От себя рекомендую первый - тамошние адские форты , и механические скорпионы меня дико проперли . 2 не понравился одним - Египетской тематикой ( после Серьезного Сэма - не воспринимаю такие уровни ) . 

Геймплейно ,  все стандартно - нам дают цепочку готичных уровней , с кучей секретов и отрядами противников ( которых с каждым эпизодом становится все больше ) . Но даже сейчас эта игра выделяется одним фактором - динамичностью . Простые солдатики проблем не вызвают , но в дальнейшем появляется противники , которые пытаются насадить вас на рога ; рыцари и прочая нечесть , которая не даст посидеть и лениво перестрелять себя . 



Отдельного упоминания заслуживает саундтрек Трента Резнора ( он просто божественный и без него , первый Квейк - не Квейк ) и атмосфера/дизайн уровней - таких готических уровней , где переплетаются мрачные замки , храмы и адские шахты ... Современным шутерам такого не хватает . 

Ну и наверное стоит упомянуть , что именно Quake по сути и создал киберспорт в современном виде . Дал шутерам ,,рокетджампы " . И подарил миру движок , на основе которого были созданы : первая Half-Life , Call of Duty и т.д. 

Итог ( скорее наболевшее ) : На последней Е3 анонсировал Quake : Champions , который по сути - перезапуск онлайновой 3 части . В связи с чем вопрос к Беезде - вы в своем уме ? У вас под носом лежит шикарный материал для годного перезапуска ( в духе последнего Дума ) , но вы решили сделать еще одну сетевую пострелкушку ... В любом случае - буду ждать и новую часть . Вдруг они создадут отличный киберспортивный снаряд . 

P.S. 9 Шамблеров из 10 .
